Reviews.Title: “Falls flat”
Reviews.Author: TeamRoberts2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed at park Place this Labor Day weekend when our normal places were sold out. We never stay on this end of town so it was adventure for us...sorry to say we will not be back to Park Place. The area is overcrowded, overrated, and under sanitary! Pros: If you enjoy being in the heart of the most congested area of the boards - this is a charm. Arrived at 10am on Sat. room was available by 11am. Inside of the room was clean, and was cleaned timely and well daily. Heard compliants from others that the elevator was slow but we really didnt have that expereince. Front desk clerk that checked us in was very nice and professional. Bed was comfortable, pillows seemed new. Always had plenty of towells. Cons: You're in the heart of the most congested area on the boards. Pool is located on 2nd floor and is filthy. Our room was on the 5th floor directly over it and i never saw a poolman actually clean the pool or ANY of the chairs or tables on the pool deck. (see pix) We spent time waiting there while our room was being prepared Sat and everything was dirty. Bartend on the 2nd floor is rude and there was an incident where the wait staff even told us that she was rude and that they had complained to the manager about her but nothing had been done. Apparently you cannt buy two drinks with one ID - if your black. Because our 'pool nieghbor', who was white, managed to do it just fine. She was more pissed than my husband which is a fete. Really not a problem crossing it off my list of places to eat considering the place was gross - chairs and tables look as if they've never seen a wet, soapy, cloth. More cons: The balcony was dirty. Its never swept and the plastic chairs are never wiped down. No irons in the rooms. (?!?) Visited the front desk to ask where the iron may be hiding and the clerk told me she could have one 'delivered'. And she sd this straight faced like it was the most reasonable thing. NOT. Especially NOT at $220 a night. The housekeeping staff ride the same elevator as guest and dont feel obligated to speak. Good morning, good night, drop dead, "yea, i'm on here with a huge bin of towells and now as a paying you have to wait" - nothing. Not one housekeeping person spoke to us our entire stay. A con that i dont think the hotel is solely responsible for - This area of beach in front of the hotel is trashy. I know this probably because its so congested and busy but, they may want to invest some energy in cleaning up the area of beach. Its gross. Overall, we will not be staying here again. Even if it was the last place in town - which it was this time. Too bad, because i enjoyed the Dough Roller next to the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Lilsassy
Reviews.Content: Good location close to everything but poorly cleaned and maintained. The room had a horrible smell and was dirty. The AC barely worked and It was kind of weird to sit on your balcony and watch people eat. When asking the staff for extra blankets it seemed to be a problem and they had an attitude. Will not be returning:(

Reviews.Title: “Good for Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: debpurn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been going to Ocean City for over 20 years, since he is from the area. Unless you are willing to spend a fortune the hotels on the boardwalk are not even 3 star quality, especially by the end of the summer season. But we love Ocean City anyway - the beach, boardwalk, weather and Thrasher's fries - and my rating of 5 stars is in comparison to other hotels we have stayed at in Ocean City. On the plus side side, the location is excellent, near many attractions on the boardwalk. We stayed in Oceanfront so we could people watch from our balcony. The parking situation was also excellent, it can be a problem at many of the other hotels. There were plenty of parking spots at the hotel, we did not have to park blocks away. The staff was also very pleasant. There were no noise issues during our stay. On the minus side, the room appeared to be clean but our socks were filthy and the tiled floor felt sticky. The linen was fine, though they had comforters on the bed which I just removed. There was a problem with our balcony door not locking but they quickly fixed it. The elevators were really slow as others have mentioned. But overall we had a great stay and would definitely stay here again for the location and parking.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: redaun2
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a real good hotel based on the reviews and the pictures the hotel posted on facebook. It turned out to be a decent motel with it's back to the beach. To go to the beach you need to walk through stores in the same building. Somehow I was under the impression this was a smoke-free hotel, not so, in fact it is a smoker's paradise. While the rooms are smoke free, the few public areas are destined to smokers: pool area, the small deck (which some 2nd floor room balconies open to and is almost like being in someone else's patio). Especially disappointing was the room balcony, so narrow it only is useful to hang out your wet stuff, don't plan to sit down and enjoy. If it rains, all you can do is sit on your bed, there is no lounge, bar or other common area to use. The room was not very clean when we checked in but they were very prompt in sending someone to fix it, and it was always cleaned properly after that, with the right amount of towels we requested. The "kitchinette" was just a mini microwave, a mine coffe maker, a minibar-like fridge and a sink. There is no way you can cook anything there, makes sense they do not include any bowls or pots with their dishes. A quart-size chinese take out does not fit in the microwave. The closet was a rod with 6 hangers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - very pleased”
Reviews.Author: mrsgfhjr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Ocean City, MD for the first time this past week. We had looked on Trip Advisor and decided to book at Park Place hotel. We had a room on the bay side and we were very pleased. The room was clean and quiet. The bed was comfortable. The elevators were a bit slow, but we have been on slower. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We liked the location of the hotel on the boardwalk, and especially enjoyed the deck that looked out over the boardwalk. We enjoyed watching the fireworks on Tuesday night. We would definitely stay here again, and in fact, when we do go back, we will request an Ocean front room.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of the ranking”
Reviews.Author: maxmyamason
Reviews.Content: Good location, decent rooms, lousy housekeeping. Got in our room and there was still a dirty wash cloth hanging from the shower curtain rod, so you have to wonder how well they actually cleaned the room. Next day we get back from the beach and the made actually left the toilet bowl brush in the bowl!! Third day sand was still on floor, tissue was not refilled, etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “OK at Best if You Have High Hopes”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysDisney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights over Dew Tour Weekend. 6 of us including 4 kids 12 and under. Location on the boardwalk was good for access to shopping, the weekends events and access to the beach and rides. The property had convenient parking and they allowed you to leave your car in the lot even after check out. The rugs seemed new and the linens and beds were acceptable. Any calls for extra paper products or extra linens were promptly responded to. Now the downside. Comforters could have used a washing. When returning from the beach there is no onsite rinse location so were were dragging sandy items all through the hotel all 3 days. If we ever were lost we could follow the sand to our room. As others have stated the elevators were not that great so we used the stairs a lot. We had a 5th floor room oceanfront which was a little noisy but if you are tired enough you can sleep through anything. The crowd later in the evening became a more mature teen crowd on the boardwalk which caused us to limit the time our younger kids were on the boardwalk after a certain hour. Overall for convenience the place was fine but if you are used to nicer properties this will be a bit of a letdown but as long as you go knowing it is not the Ritz and do not have high hopes you will be fine. If I go to OC MD again I probably would try another property first just to get a gauge for future visits but if nothing was available I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: foodman86
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy to find and parking was adequate. Elevator service can be difficult at times. Not the easiest access to the beach/boardwalk if you need to use a wheel chair. It can be a bit awkward getting up the stairs with all your beach stuff when there are people waiting in line to dine on the terrace. People are always cleaning and I sometimes felt bad for them trying to keep up with the mess people make. Our room was satisfactory. One day the maids didn't make the beds but everything else was in order there were some stains on the carpet and the love seat looked a little dingy but on the whole we enjoyed our stay. The pool was the biggest dissapointment, not only was it small it was very dirty all the time. It may be a bit above average but not spectacular. We would stay again. Bar/ Dining terrace can be a bit noisy at times.

Reviews.Title: “Love It so Much !!! Wont stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Pennylten
Reviews.Content: My husband and I Love Ocean City !! WE have stayed at other places,with the more known names. Very dissatisfied.WE found Park Place 4 years ago. WE actually ask for same room 408 each time and only a couple of times we took a differan troom,(I didnt book early enough) The staff have never dsiappointed us.ALWAYS get a hello fom housekeeping and all. Linens are clean ,room is great!!! WE try to stay one week around senior week and one at sunfest. They go above and beyond in reservations.I should have booked when there at first of summer,when I called for sunfest no openings oceanfront and Im spoiled only stay oceanfront.They said if anyone canceled they would get back to me.and it was not dont call me Ill call you type of thing .They did call as I knew they would and I will be oceanfront sunfest!!! GREAT place to stay.Love the on site parking.WE would have cancelled going if we did not get a room there thats how well we like it. Bar is excellant!! NO complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and customer service”
Reviews.Author: mls_oh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Park Place Hotel in June. This was our first oceanfront stay. We arrived early and were given a parking pass and a key card to access the pool area, and were told they would call us when the room was ready. We went out for lunch and by the time we were finished, our room was ready. Evelyn was working the front desk and she was very friendly and professional and made us feel welcome. Our room was on the fifth floor and we had a view of the boardwalk and the beach. An added bonus is that we arrived during the Air Show, and we had a great view of the air show from our balcony. That was unplanned and yet probably the favorite part of our stay. We could also see the pier in the distance. This was a great location for people watching. We didn't leave the sliding doors open at night due to the fact that it was senior week and a little loud, but with the doors closed, we did not hear any noise as we slept. Our room was clean and our housekeeper was Pam who did a wonderful job. We dined at Conner's Beach Cafe on the 2nd floor deck as well as the ground floor restaurant. The food was average and the service was good. Things that were not an issue for us that might be an issue for others include the fact that the pool is rather small and it's on the street side (bay side) of the hotel and not the ocean side. Also, to access the boardwalk, there are stairs from the second floor, although I did see people cutting through the ground floor restaurant. We loved the location, and the fact that we could catch the boardwalk tram right outside of the hotel. We would definitely stay here again, and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “last chance to fine a place”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: wanting some where different not the same nj shore show we went to ocean maryland was looking for hotel the same day we went there came open park place it was great the service was great the room was clean and the bathroom also. The balcony was small but it was nice to wake up to the ocean view. We are look forward to next year.

Reviews.Title: “clean, decent place”
Reviews.Author: MarilynDiane
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and it was an enjoyable hotel. The rooms were very quiet and quite comfortable. The bathroom was large, and clean. Loved the bath and body works shampoo and soap. The pool was a bit small. I would basically say it was a bit over average for most things. It was comfortable not spectacular. Clean. The TV large and was nice. The balcony was nice. It was a bit over-priced I would say. The pictures on the wall were a bit dull. The rooms were very clean and that was a bonus. Off street parking was good also. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BANKERCHIC061904
Reviews.Content: We have been staying a this hotel for a few years now. We just stayed there this past week and enjoyed our stay. The first night we did have a problem with the toilet being clogged but they immediately came up and fixed it. The refrigerator was a little old and off balanced but it did work. The only reason I am saying anything is because the price of the rooms and you might expect things to be perfection. The staff is very friendly! The hotel has a cafe and deck on the boardwalk side and we ate there a lot and the food was yummy! The one thing I did notice is the employees are always cleaning things and power washing the decks. They always keep up with the elevators and wiping them down. I would totally recommend this hotel and we will definitely continue to go back there. Just wish the price wasn't so much. One other thing is the only place to wash your sandy chairs and yourself off is at the pool area. There is nothing outside of any of the hotels in this area to clean off before you go up to your rooms. Just wish the boardwalk would have something set up when you walk off the beach like some of the areas on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not very clean!”
Reviews.Author: jenniferdesigns
Reviews.Content: We had an oceanfront room and the view was great! The room was a bit dated looking, but appeared clean. But on closer inspection there was dust on every surface, the walls under the bathroom sink were splattered all over with something and there was some medication laying on the bathroom floor that must have been dropped by a prior guest. Also the mattress in the fold out sofa bed was literally falling to pieces. And the sheets on the beds were not terribly clean. That being said, I did not call to complain because, though it was not perfect, I could live with it. The only reason it bothered me at all was because of the price of the room, when I am paying a lot for a room, the least I expect is for it to be clean. But I would stay there again, the location alone is worth it!! But I will complain about the cleanliness if it is an issue again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: rndtax
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Park Place for 3 nights leading into 4th of July week. Our room was clean and comfortable. It was "bayside" (actually street side) overlooking the pool. It was quiet - not sure that the boardwalk side would be as quiet, especially 2nd floor rooms, given the cafe and deck on the boardwalk side. The location is very convenient. It's right on the boardwalk with easy access to the beach between 2 nd & 3rd streets. [Note to GPS users: the Trip Advisor address is a loading dock. The driving directions lead you to a funky art gallery on 2nd Street. Use 208 N Baltimore Ave instead.] The hotel staff is very courteous and efficient. We understand that it is family owned and operated. Certainly, the level of customer care and service provided reflects a complete commitment to customer satisfaction All in all, we were very pleased and will stay here again when we return to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: lmhs94
Reviews.Content: Booked this room as a late graduation present, and had to go through several tasks to have our group stay as some were under 18. We are a quiet group, so they had no problem taking us. I'm so glad they let us book the room. I've been to many hotels, and this hotel was the best I've been to in OCMD. The room was clean, parking was a breeze, staff were super friendly, and the maids were very accommodating. They made sure that this hotel is kept nice, and that the guests adhere to their policies. The pool was somewhat small, but very clean, as was the area around the pool. Only thing I would have to complain about, is the fact that there is No air conditioning in the elevators. But that is the least of problems, I have already booked my next stay for later this summer :)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tchele07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights and we love it! Beach and boardwalk is right outside rooms were clean they even had plates and cups in the cupboards which was nice Bcuz we forgot to bring some. The employees were sooooo nice we asked for a couple things and they brought them to us within 5 minutes and were very nice about it. I will stay here over and over again it was a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: trensha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the 4th of July week. We arrived early (10AM) and were greeted by very friendly staff. We parked on the hotel lot and were given our parking pass and a key to the pool and restrooms. Later that afternoon, when our room was ready, the hotel staff called (we were lounging on the beach) to let us know our room was available. The room was clean and spacious. There were two double beds and a sofa sleeper. In addition, there was a kitchenette with a microwave, refrigerator, and sink. Dishes, dish liquid and dish towels were also included. The housekeeping staff (Lynette) was very friendly. She did an excellent job cleaning our room each day and leaving fresh towels. The hotel is very close to all of the downtown attractions. We did not move the car during our stay and enjoyed walking everywhere. On checkout day, we mentioned we were spending the day on the beach and the staff offered us a key to access the pool and restrooms. A huge plus when you have little ones. This was a very enjoyable visit to Ocean City and we will be returning to this hotel again. I definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: shelllady
Reviews.Content: It was fun being right on the boardwalk. The only issue we had, the hotel has no control over. The people on the boardwalk at night were too noisy to leave the sliding glass door open to hear the waves. The hotel staff did everything possible to make our stay enjoyable (which it was). The room was clean, and everyone we dealt with was polite and helpful. Pluses include that the room has a small refrigerator, a coffee maker and a microwave. A few utensils, dishes and dish soap are also included. We recommend Park Place Hotel, especially if you want to be in the middle of OC action.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tanya B
Reviews.Content: First time ever staying at Park Place and we will definetely stay here again!! Very clean, very polite staff. Had no issues! Would recommend this place to our friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family-owned Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HumminAlong
Reviews.Content: For those of you who know something about Ocean City's history, Park Central is located on the site of the old Hastings-Miramar Hotel between 2nd and 3rd St on the boardwalk. It is still owned and operated by the Conner family who also developed The Dunes and Dunes Manor. Park Place is a modern facility with a great beach cafe and SailLoft Bar on the second level, on a deck overlooking the beach and boardwalk. We stayed here for two nights and three days the first week of June. Just a brief vacation. Wanted to try a beachfront hotel for a change. Loved our 6th floor room with balcony. Great views of the ocean and boardwalk. Just two plastic chairs on a narrow concrete deck, but there is a privacy wall. We enjoyed watching the gulls soar overhead and swoop down to the boardwalk below. Noise wasn't too bad, even though it was Senior Week. The 6th floor location probably helped. There is a nice HVAC system with a fan for white noise, if you need it. The room itself was huge--long with a bath and kitchen when you first walk in, then two double beds in front of a console with flat screen TV; a sleeper sofa and table and two chairs are nearest the sliding glass door to the balcony. Plenty of room for a family to spread out. Sofa was very comfortable and great for reading with a view of the ocean beyond. The kitchen has a microwave, half-sized refrigerator, and sink. Good beds, slept well. Our room was very clean, and room service did an excellent job the next day tidying up and providing fresh towels. We enjoyed a lunch and breakfast at the Conner Beach Cafe which is located on the second level. It is elevated over the boardwalk and provides a great view of the ocean and people walking by. Loved the palm trees and shaded tables. But, best of all were the local waitresses and bartender who are excellent! Our breakfast of pancakes and French toast was the best; lunch of softshell blue crab sandwiches was yummy, too--good old-fashioned Eastern Shore cooking. Female crabs, but that is another story... On the other side of the steps down to the boardwalk is a deck with rocking chairs overlooking the ocean. Nice! I think this hotel has the best location on the boardwalk. It is just two blocks from N. Division St where all the action is, but located on the widest and most beautiful part of the beach. We set up our chairs on the beach directly in front of the hotel and had no neighbors until 12 noon. Ahhh.... We took the boardwalk tram the full length of the boardwalk, and honestly--Park Place has the best oceanfront rooms of all the boardwalk hotels, and we have stayed at many of them over the years. The beach in Ocean City is very nice-- soft sand with a gentle, long wave to a flat shore line. Perfect for body-surfing; some shells, but no rocks or pebbles. The city has placed wooden play equipment for toddlers periodically along the beach--pirate ships and castles. There are also volleyball nets for the older set. Park Place has the best of OC below it on the boardwalk: Park Place Jewelers, Dough Rollers, Bull On the Beach, Name on Rice... Take a walk and you will see Elvis impersonators, Beatles bands, an OC Cruise-In with vintage automobiles... Who needs Vegas?! Loved it. Thank you, OC and Park Place Hotel for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Visit”
Reviews.Author: Kimmybigbuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our 1 year old Son as part of a month-long American holiday. We spent 3 nights here. The hotel is situated smack-bang in the middle of the Ocean City Boardwalk. You couldn't get closer if you tried. There is an exit from your hotel to the front (car-park) or the back which takes you straight out to the boardwalk and the beach. As we stayed a week this side of Memorial day we were technically staying 'out of season'. I think that was good as we had a 1 year old with us and although I can't say for sure I imagine this hotel's location could be a little loud in peak season. We enjoyed walking on the boardwalk every day. We loved seeing the kites flying on the beach and the people enjoying the warm sunny days with their families. We tried a few foods that the boardwalk is famous for. Crab sandwich, icecream, fries that people line up for half an hour for (well worth the wait too). Our room was very well kept and cleaned well each day. Everyone we met in the building was very friendly. Breakfast was complimentary and the standard hotel breakfast you expect these days. Definately would stay here again. On a side note when we left the hotel we forgot to pack our son's sleeping outfit and we contacted the hotel via email the next day to see if they had found it. They had and at our cost (of course) they shipped it to us at our next location. The matter was handling very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “It could be a great hotel, too bad it is not”
Reviews.Author: Galaxy775
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a king room on a sixth floor over the Memorial Day Weekend, The room is large. The view of the boardwalk and ocean is great and location for walking the boardwalk is good too. That's were good things end. Despite management's claim that rooms have been renovated, they are very dated and plain old. Yes, you can see that walls are freshly painted and there are flat screen TV, but that's it. The main problem with this place that there seems to be no thought put into the details: -Towels are so thin, you could practically see through them, - blankets have holes, - drapes have holes and stains. - There are two plastic chairs on the balcony, but no table. So if you want to have a glass of water or a wine with you while watching the waves, you have to hold the glass all the time or put it down on the floor that has birds poop on it. Yes, there is no awning or any kind of cover on the sixth floor balcony so you are at the mercy of the birds flying overhead. - Bayview rooms are a joke. You might see something from the sixth floor but all the other floors get a view of the dumpster and a parking lot. -Oceanview rooms on the second floor get no view at all, just their closed drapes. They are directly on the patio that is occupied by a restaurant and a bar. Unless you want people eating and drinking while watching you in the room, you'll have to keep the drapes closed. Plus even if you opened the drapes, all you see is people eating and drinking. -To get to the boardwalk, you have to get down (or up) two flights of stairs. Entrance is closed at midnight, after that you have to go around this hotel and a neighboring building and through the dark alley to get back. -Only one elevator goes down to the parking level but it does not open its doors most of the times. It comes down to the Ground level and goes back up, that can happen one or more times in a row until it feels like letting you out to the parking. You could get out on the 1st floor and take the stairs, which we did most times but when you have your luggage with you, that's a problem. My husband went down and back up three times before the elevator opened its doors on the Ground level. But the kicker is the front desk's response when I told them about this problem; "Oh, yeah. It does it sometimes. Do you want to charge the rest of your balance to your MasterCard?" And that brings me to the REAL BIG problem with this place - complete absence of customer service. -Don't bother asking front desk for the dinning recommendations. They'll whip out a piece of paper with typed up restaurant names and phone numbers and send you to the most touristy ones that have the worst rating on both Tripadvisor and Yelp. -Housekeeping does not nod, smile or say hello when passing guests in the hallway. I think this is the only hotel where stuff does not greet its guests in some way. -If a member of the stuff with a large cart full of dirty things needs to get on the elevator, that's a priority. Never mind that elevator is full of the guests. -The first night we stayed, our room was not cleaned and made. Granted, we left "DND" sign on it until 4pm in the afternoon but no one bothered to check in with us if we need it to be cleaned afterwards. Usually, housekeeping would leave you a note asking you to call them when you want your room to be serviced. Not in this place. The second day, room was cleaned, marginally. I left a pair of the sandals by my nightstand and they have not been moved at all. I guess, they just vacuumed around them. You could still see dust in the corners of the room and next to the walls. I could go on but by now you get the idea, The real shame is that this could have been a great place but owners don't seem to have interest in anything except getting your money.

Reviews.Title: “3 day vacation”
Reviews.Author: whimpy
Reviews.Content: I can not say one bad thing about this place we were there 3 night second week in may oceanfront room the service was great you couldnt ask for nicer people at the front desk the room was very clean and the price was great too I would stay her again In a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Familyvacationer101
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the sixth floor oceanfront room at the Park Place Hotel. The view and location were perfect. The off-season price was reasonable as well. The heated outdoor pool was great and being able to walk down the steps and be directly on the boardwalk and beach was terrific. The hotel was clean and comfortable as well. Overall an excellent experience at the Park Place Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Cbaz128
Reviews.Content: The oceanfront view cannot be beat, the hotel is right on the boardwalk. The off season price was more than reasonable for 5th floor king size. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. I enjoyed how the towels were folded and I was surprised that the hotel soap, shampoo and conditioner were from Bath and Body Works. Our room had a small supply of dishes and eating utensils, fridge, microwave and sink which was convenient. Bring your own coffee, tho, the coffee supplied is awful. There is no continental breakfast, so bring your own or expect to eat out. Although we awoke to an overcast, dreary sky, it was still wonderful to sleep to the sound of the waves and to be able to see them from the bed. We were only there for one night and did not have an opportunity to go in the pool. I would return again, but I would never go there during peak season.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , with views and more”
Reviews.Author: drube77
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay and they never disappoint. The rooms are clean and include a dinette . The staff is courteous and the ocean front rooms are great . It is a touch pricey but for being right on the boardwalk and beach its well worth it .We are coming back again in September and for many years to come .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; basic beach motel”
Reviews.Author: loveisbliss
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at this particular OC hotel. I have returned because of the great boardwalk location and the pleasant owners of the property. This time I was lured in by an email that I had received advertising that the oceanfront 5th and 6th floors had been "completely renovated" for this season. Although I already had other trips planned, I decided to book 5 nights because a newly renovated room, OF, for only $81/night is exciting. The positives of this hotel is their location, on property parking, and clean facility. However, we were extremely disappointed with the "complete renovation." The room looked like it was recently painted and a new table and 2 chairs had been resplaced along with flat screen TVs. Other than that, the bedding was old and very poor quality. The mattress was most uncomfortable and old. The bathroom still had the standard straight rod versus the new curved rods. The towels were very poor quality; crisp, not at all soft. And, the carpet was not replaced as I had expected. Definately not a "complete renovation." Because I had only paid $81/nt, I did not complain. However, if I had paid the summer rate of $299, I certainly would have complained! Visiting off season in May gives you an affordable rate. However, half of the shops and restaurants including the pier had not opened yet for the season and the ones that were open, closed up by 6pm. I understand this from the business perspective, however; for the visitor, it is very disappointing. Please understand that the hotel is a good choice. It is clean and the owners are on sight to take care of any issues. In comparison to other properties, I would chose this hotel again. However, for the summer rate of $299...in comparison to that-in August we are staying in Myrtle Beach at Northbeach Plantation for $325/nt for a 2BR condo. It is an incredible property. Look up that web site. For the money, there is no comparison!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will be back!”
Reviews.Author: DKNY21
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great spot on the boardwalk. We stayed in the king oceanfront room, very clean, beautiful view. Staff was very friendly. When we visit Ocean City again we will definitely be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: tammyBoonton_NJ
Reviews.Content: I was so worried about staying here since I am very picky when it comes to cleanliness. I thought I was going to walk into the typical beach hotel with the musty smell, worn carpet etc. but...........I was pleasantly surprised to see the room was spotless and I do mean spotless. I did not see one speck of dirt anywhere, including the bathroom. I gave housekeeping a nice tip and they deserved every penny. Check in and check out took only minutes. The location was great too, right on the boardwalk, steps from the beach. We saw dolphins in the morning swimming the shoreline. We ate at their restaurant for lunch and the chicken caesar wrap with sweet potato fries were very good. Dunkin Donuts is only a few blocks away - that was a real plus for me. I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised it has such a high rating on Trip Advisor....”
Reviews.Author: 50onthego
Reviews.Content: Because it's really not so much. It wasn't very clean. There was some sort of liquid that had run down the front and sides of our refrigerator and dried there, and there were many other instances of "icky" I detected throughout the room including a large spot on the couch. Being picky on cleanliness, I really can no longer tolerate the patterned, quilt-like "bedspreads" that are not washed after every hotel guest, and this place is living in the past by serving up those re-used, re-slept on bedspreads. I know that they are required to wash them once a week by hotel mandated rules, but that's not tolerable for me. I try to only stay in hotels where I have a white bedspread where I can smell that it just came out of the bleached laundry water. The room, however, was spacious and did include a couch which is always a big plus in my book, but the TV was quite small. The lobby was filled with so much stuff it looked messy. Throughout the hotel, you get the feeling that it was furnished and decorated as cheaply as possible. Although it's somewhat tasteful, it's just feels chintzy. For $120.00 for an off season evening in the beginning of April, and for this hotel not serving any type of continental breakfast, having any type of pool, and lacking in other areas, I would say the value here was certainly lackluster. Having read other reviews on Trip Advisor, I would recommend the Holiday Inn or the Hilton. Unfortunately, they were fully booked the night we visited. The location is, however, excellent as it is one of the few hotels right on the boardwalk in Atlantic City. So if that is a priority for you, I would say that this hotel is certainly tolerable and sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, fairly clean”
Reviews.Author: kangaBaltimore
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice location, right on the boardwalk. Clean. No pets allowed which was perfect for us since one in our group has severe pet dander allergies. Nice parking. My only upset was that they consider anyone over 13 as an adult and charge extra for them to be in the room. This is the first time I have run into this. Caught me quite by surprise. Otherwise a pleasant experience

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good rate, on the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: Chris L
Reviews.Content: Just returned to OCMD after about 15 years. Stayed at this hotel due to Trip Advisor ratings and comments. Overall, good property for the money. Clean, convenient, staff was friendly. Located in the heart of the boardwalk so easy walking to just about anywhere. One of the better places i have been in OC.

Reviews.Title: “Off season, but still a wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: Mary C
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for 2 nights for boyfriend's birthday in early March 2011. We got a great rate for the hotel and it's location, and we really enjoyed our stay, despite the fact that it rained -- no, monsooned -- nearly the entire time. Not much is open on the boardwalk that time of year, but we did go to Marty's Playland and drove across the bridg ef for food from Waterman's. Also ate at the Dough Rollers almost next door to hotel. Conor's allegedly served breakfast to guests, but it wasn't open that we could tell. Not a big deal, because we went out to get donuts. Like I said, a great deal for that time of year as long as you realize that there's not much to do except enjoy the hotel. Also, they were renovating while we were there. Not on our floor, but we saw the ripped up carpet, etc. when using the steps to the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury? No. But for OC, it has its perks.”
Reviews.Author: Baltowkids
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at various hotels in OC, including Princess Bayside (right by Seacrets), Holiday Inn on 17th, Sea Watch Condos, etc, etc. We have young children and very much enjoyed the convenience of being on the Board Walk. The Holiday Inn gets 5 stars as it is a nicer, newer hotel (with an awesome pool area!) than Park Place but it is ridiculously expensive, $400+/night during the summer. So, we looked for an alternative and frankly, Park Place worked fine for our needs. We went in June 2011 - this review is a little late. We do not spend a lot of time just sitting in our hotel room. We were out and about on our 3 night weekend, shopping, going on rides, tandem biking, eating lots of junk. There is nothing luxurious about this hotel but you will find that luxury is difficult to come by in OC. So the four star ranking definitely takes that into consideration. The pool is very small but our kids didn't care. My hubby would go down to Conner's, grab us drinks and bring them up to the pool while our kids splashed around. Again, the most important thing about this hotel is its convenience. You really can't ask for much better being so close to all of the action. You could hear a little bit of what is going on outside (room overlooking the boardwalk) but it really wasn't a huge issue most likely because we were exhausted. Not sure I would want to to do more than a few days here with our larger family due to the small size of the rooms but it was good for what we needed for our short visit. Our room had two double beds and a pullout sofa so fits 6 people (and really not much else!). Room had a sink and microwave which is nice although we didn't really have a need for them. If price not a big deal for you and you like a little luxury, try the Holiday Inn on 17th (yes, further from action but still on boarwalk) but if you want some value, better convenience, and are willing to part with some luxury, Park Place gets you bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Off Season Stay”
Reviews.Author: Laura R
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay over New Years. The only problem that we had was the walls are very thin and we were woke up on New Years Day from the neighbors having "a good time". The hotel location is great. They should consider having automatic doors so it is easier to get you luggage into the hotel

Reviews.Title: “The Second Time Around”
Reviews.Author: Lil_Bunny84
Reviews.Content: I keep forgetting to post this review. It was the second time around for us here at Park Place. This place is great for families, a last minute trip or weekend trip. We stayed at Park Place again this past summer in June during Senior Week. We had our 2 yr old daughter with us and I was pregnant at the time. The hot water was shut off there were warning signs posted in front of the elevator doors on each floor of the hotel. Apparently it was going on b/c of a major repair that needed to be done. But we did not notice, it must have been off only briefly since I wasn't greeted by a cold shower (though I was sadly expecting it). The location is the best because you are right on the boardwalk which worked out great for us because I was entering my 3rd trimester, walking and extended time in vehicle was becoming challenging and painful. Park Place never disappoints us, it's family friendly and drama free even during Senior Week (one of the most drama filled times/weeks that Ocean City experiences). As a matter of fact, they banned the rowdy and drunken Senior Week party goers and boardwalk drunkards from using the hotel's facilities mainly the bathroom at night (even put a sign up and locked the doors) many would ask to use the bathroom in the hotel and corner the Conner's staff. They weren't having any of it and didn't even entertain the sarcastic questions like "so where do you go to the bathroom then?". Many asked and were turned away. The Conner's Beach Cafe breakfast buffet is the way to go if you're a breakfast person I know I am and you don't want to have to venture too far and no frills. The price is very reasonable and it's all you care to eat. I will always remember this hotel for returning my digital camera to me after I lost it during my first stay here. Something almost unheard of these days. This hotel is becoming a family favorite for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location rooms better than expected”
Reviews.Author: powder068
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits on the boardwalk right in the heart of OC. I travel to OC very often and found that this place offers a good affordable option. The rooms are a little bit smaller but typical of this area. The room choices usually include 2 beds....very minimal King choice but also very typical. The balcony was large and the extra room with sofa was ample. The beds here were OK.....I have had worse but also better. Great choice for families and couples!

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: talbbe1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect to have a wonderful location and ocean view. Rooms are clean and have lots of extras we even had bath & body works toiletries! The location is great you are very close to the start of the boardwalk and that is where the best restaurants and shops are. You can walk everywhere! The rates were so cheap for the off season we paid $50 a night during the week, the only bad thing is that most places close in Sept or Oct so their isn't as much to do at night.

Reviews.Title: “Off-Season Trip”
Reviews.Author: Kara M
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Ocean City Md, at Park Place Hotel, primarily due to the reviews here on Trip Advisor. We took other traveler's advice and asked for Ocean View room on a higher up floor. We stayed on the 5th floor. What a wonderful view. We were in OC, off season, which made it much quieter but a lot of attractions were closed. We stayed from Wed Oct 19 to Sat Oct 22. Wed, Thu nights were very quiet and peaceful. Friday night we could hear the movement, voices, tv etc from the room next door, but luckily the people quieted down as it got later so there were no issues for us. Our biggest complaint was the room smelled musty when we walked in. We opened the slider to the balcony and the musty smell quickly left. It's possible, the smell was from the A/C since it was turned on when we arrived. We turned it off and left it off for the duration of our stay because it was in the 60's everyday and we didn't notice the musty smell again. Another issue is we were getting dived bombed by seagulls when we went out on the balcony. This happened twice and both times were due to the guest, on the balcony below us, feeding them. When he was not out there, the birds left us alone. The bed was comfortable. The towels plentiful. The kitchenette was great because we could store beverages in there, we made popcorn one night. The TV had plenty of channels. The Wi-Fi was great and we were happy that was available. The room was clean. The staff was very helpful when we asked about local restaurants and gave us their recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: LinaK221
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Ocean City and have been coming here for several years. The place is very clean, the staff very friendly, and it's right on the boardwalk. The rooms are a good size...most are two double beds, pull out couch, small table with two chairs, and a balcony. There is a pool and a restaurant and bar (not a fan of the restaurant). There are chairs out front on the big balcony to relax and watch the boardwalk and ocean. I have always had bayside facing rooms. Maybe next year we'll get an ocean front! This place is awesome! My only complaint- the pillows are very soft and mushy. I had to use two to get any support. But the hotel is WONDERFUL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to all of it's reviews”
Reviews.Author: TLC54
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Park Place this past weekend for three days. From start to finish, our stay was one of the best I have ever had. We arrived three hours early, and the front desk gave us our parking pass and told us to go enjoy lunch and the boardwalk, and they would call when our room was ready. We hadn't even been gone ten minutes, and they called us. We checked into our room around 12:30. We had a nice room on the fifth floor overlooking the lower deck, boardwalk, and ocean. The room was very clean and our view was fantastic. There is a really nice little kitchenette with a microwave, fridge and sink. There are even dishes and dishwashing fluid and towels. The room had a newer flat screen tv and a fold out couch. We were very comfortable, and if you needed anything, the hotel responded immediately. The pool is on the bay side of the property...very clean and very easy to get to. There are two bathrooms near it that you can use with your key. It is on the same floor as the restaurant deck. We ate at the restaurant...very good. You cannot beat this location, and you cannot beat the service...we felt very comfortable there. It is an older property, but they maintain it very well. They stock the bathroom with "Bath and Body" products. We most definately will return...it is such a pleasure to find a place like this to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awesdme location!! Good rooms, clean hotel, very good service!”
Reviews.Author: allprima
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute for Labor Day weekend. They originally had a 3 night minimum but I spoke to Vicki in Reservations who was really great and said she could allow us to stay for only 2. We had a bayview room w/ a balcony overlooking the pool with 2 beds which was very clean and a really good deal considering we booked last minute for the holiday weekend. Keep in mind it is not a luxury hotel, but a solid 3 star property. All of the staff including housekeeping was very helpful and the hotel's location was the best!! It was directly on the boardwalk where all the action is and a 5 minute walk from the amusement parks. The hotel also had a really nice deck on the 2nd floor with a bar and patio overlooking the beach and a nice jewelry store attached to the lobby where I bought a pretty necklace (not expensive). Overall a great choice for Ocean City and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: plspa
Reviews.Content: Great location for just spending time relaxing and walking boardwalk, riding bikes, etc. Staff were friendly, efficient, hotel was very clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Conveinient”
Reviews.Author: cdoc29
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel right on the Boardwalk. We had an Ocean Front Efficiency. Two double beds, Couch, table with two chairs, small microwave, fridge and sink with some dishes and bathroom with shower tub. Room was clean and staff kept it that way, always clean when we got back from breakfast around 11:30. Good room for Families, not so good for Romantic Getaway for two. Two biggest draws were small balcony (enough room for two chairs) and since we had a stroller the only direct access to the boardwalk was through the Hotel restaurant dining room, other wise it's a walk down a fight and a half of stairs from the second floor. Price was reasonable for location, easy walk to everything and really no need to drive anywhere unless your looking to play some mini golf and don't want to take the bus. Staff very friendly and accommodating no issues during the trip. Would recommend for families.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our 4th of July weekend getaway to this great location.”
Reviews.Author: happysojourner
Reviews.Content: We had a balcony room on the top floor mid hotel and the fireworks and symphony orchestra which accompanied the show was just wonderful. We both love the beach and Ocean City is truly a great place to spend a four night vacation. The restaurants and beach were top shelf and enjoyed walking the boardwalk in the evening and taking the shuttle back to our downtown location. This really is a great place for both couples and families with children who would enjoy a nice visit. We took the Lewes Ferry across the water and it was most enjoyed and a good purchase as it carred both our vehicle and passengers safety across the water to Ocean City Maryland. We look forward to our next visit in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: msjr100
Reviews.Content: First time here and it was a very good experience. Very clean hotel with a great location. Only negatives was the elevators were slow and the pool is a little small, but those are very minor issues. Parking spaces are very small. Was a great stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Rod Week”
Reviews.Author: edwardjba
Reviews.Content: Location Location Beach Boards Clean Rooms Pool great rates and a perfect view with a bar overlooking the boards Very Beachy Place Ed B

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: samd05
Reviews.Content: My family has vacationed at this hotel for the past 10 years and it just keeps getting better. CLEAN, ACCOMODATING AND FRIENDLY, PROFESSIONAL STAFF. From the welcoming, efficient front lobby staff, to the well maintained pool deck and swimming pool, to the excellent ocean front restaurant overlooking the boardwalk, beach and ocean. And then there are the comfortable, safe and CLEAN rooms, all prepared for your arrival. PARK PLACE HOTEL is simply the BEST!!! Reasonably priced for all that you get. The location, you can't beat. Right on the board walk at 2nd Street with shops and eateries galore and with a direct ocean view and access to OCMD's clean, wide and FREE beaches, with the best OC Beach Patrol life guards. This place just makes your vacation all the better. And did I mention, accommodating??? You won't hear the word "no". I am very grateful that after all of these years and all of the growth of OCMD, this hotel has kept itself up, with clean and modern facilities and professional, friendly and caring staff members. When we arrived in our room, it was welcoming and ready with a brand new shower/bath and granite sink and counter. We couldn't get the room safe to work however, so we called the front desk and within 3 minutes, the manager was at our door with the maintence man. It needed a new battery which he installed right there and then, with a smile. O M G, where do you find that kind of service today??? We were able to go straight to the beach and enjoy our vacation with peace of mind. At night, the great views from our balcony were beautiful and relaxing and we all slept like babies. Thank you again, Park Place Hotel manager, for keeping your facility up to date and for caring about its good reputation and its customers. We'll see you next Summer!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: dahead
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with the family. Good location, with an exit to the boardwalk. Within walking distance of restaurants and amusement parks. There is a restaurant on the second floor of the hotel, with a good happy hour and a nice deck to watch the beachgoers. Clean hotel, our balcony faced the pool and they were always cleaning the area. Cleaning staff overzealous at times though looking to get you out of your rooms early mornings so that they can clean. They were not very friendly. I can't remember one single staff person saying hello to us while passing them in the hallway or elevator. Good location too if you want to go over to the restaurants over the rte. 50 bridge and w/in walking distance to the boat rides at the talbot street pier. The game room is a joke - its really a closet with 4 or 5 arcade games. I think you can only fit one person per game in that room. location is really the reason to stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A very "beachy" hotel”
Reviews.Author: dermite
Reviews.Content: Park Place Hotel is your typical east coast beach hotel (for those from NJ think "Wildwood"). It's old. It's dated. People hang their beach towels on the railings. It has drop ceilings and sky blue painted walls. It has rust and shower/tub inserts covering who-knows-what. The carpet is relatively new and overall the place is kept pretty clean. There is no a/c in the bathroom because the place doesn't have central air. We booked here because when we book a local vacation we wait to see what the weather will be and only then do we book a room so you pretty much have to take what you can get. While we were in Ocean City I stopped in the Holiday Inn and the Hilton just to take a peek and they were both beautiful, but fully booked and very expensive. I would stay here again only because I don't expect more for the price in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zoeman
Reviews.Content: Park Place is nice clean hotel which has good location and where the staff is friendly. Typically we research the heck out of the place before we book. In this case we wanted to make sure the Hotel on OC was family friendly, clean, and centrally located on the boardwalk. While you may not consider Park Place to have 4 star amenities it had all the trappings of a great hotel. The owners seem to always be on premise and are happy to give restaurant recco's, the staff is great, the rooms are clean, location is ideal and the price is reasonable.. This place is especially friendly to families with children. Also, skip the buffet bfast at Connors and head to Dough Boy for pancakes.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit and Will be Back”
Reviews.Author: ASHMD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this same hotel several years ago for the same reasons that brought me back. Primarily I didn't want to have to move my car and drive up and down coastal highway and we wanted to be on the boardwalk near the rides. With a small child, frankly, location is EVERYTHING. We stayed here for a week and checked in on a Saturday. The front desk attendant Evelyn was extremely friendly. She noticed our little boy and asked if we'd like to use the pool until our room was ready. She provided us a key to access the pool/restrooms and took our cell phone number so that she could reach us in case our room was ready early. While heading upstairs we heard a call come in over the walkie talkies that the cleaning staff were using letting them know that we had arrived. Our room was ready within the hour which was way before check in time and in time for my son's nap. Kudos to the hotel on this. We asked the front desk to ensure our room was clean by 1pm everyday so that we could get in for my son's nap. We were out of the room by 10am and they were able to accomodate this request which we appreciated. The room was clean and adequate. The pool is small but clean and was large enough for us to splash around in in the afternoons. We had a bay view on the 5th floor which was quite nice. The location on the boardwalk cannot be beat. I think we only drove the car once or twice during our entire trip. The 2nd floor bar area has happy hour everyday with drink specials. The $2 magaritas were a big hit with us! We will definately be back to Park Place! Hotel offered free WIFI which was a huge bonus for me as I checked email daily from the comfort of our balcony. Parking was tight but mostly because other patrons were parked poorly.

Reviews.Title: “great time once again”
Reviews.Author: sheri28
Reviews.Content: Once again a great time in OC and at Park Place.The hotel is in aperfect location and the biggest part its clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, location, friendly, location...did i mention location?”
Reviews.Author: pa_miner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and children. Clean rooms, friendly staff, amazing location. Going through the restraunt was a funky way to get to the beach, but very quick--they let you go through even if its not open yet. Rooms were always cleaned early, good when you have small children who nap late morning. Pool was clean and well maintained. Did not try the deck bar. Will be back this year.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Spot”
Reviews.Author: djdelite
Reviews.Content: Start off..Our room was ready way before check in time and the front desk clerks very friendly. This already put a smile on my face because my daughter wanted to go out on the beach right away. The room was very clean an our cleaning lady was on point. She would come early every morning an not only clean up but reassure that we could have anything needed. I like the location of the hotel which is not too far from the boardwalk rides. The hotel was clean and neat absolutely no problem with the room or refrigerator etc. We also had a friend come into town for the day as well and staff was nice enough to let them park in their hotel parking lot. THANKS AGAIN.. Pool area was fun and clean. I'm glad to have read other great reviews which lead me to this hotel. The only negatives which was not that serious is the elevators take really long and operate slow but hop on the stairs an your at the 2nd floor which leads to the boardwalk/beach area. The restaurant Conners attached to the hotel was not all that great in terms of lunch. Overall I stayed at the Breakers Hotel last year but honestly must say prefer this one more. I will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nedia
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. It was our first time there, but will stay there again when in OC. We had an oceanfront efficiency that was very comfortable & we especially liked the small kitchenette. We had to call about a problem with the screen and it was taken care of immediately. All of the staff were very nice and accommodating. It is a slightly older hotel, so if you like new & modern, it is not for you. However it is well taken care of & very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: MCY825
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I ranging from ages 27-37 thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. All we kept saying was how great the location was! We had an ocean front room on the 5th floor. A suggestion if you are planning on staying here is to ask for a room one one of the top floors. The hotel only has 6 floors and since it is right on the boardwalk it could be a little noisy if you were on the lower floors. The room was neat, cleaned everyday, and was considerable spacious. We had 6 people in our room, 2 full size beds and a pull-out couch. It was a bit cramped but we packed out the room to save $ and were barely in the room so it did not matter to us. We checked out the pool just to see it but didn't go hang out there because the beach was right there, it looked nice and clean. The beach, boardwalk, rides, bars, restaurants, and bus stop are all right outside the door of this hotel. We parked the car on Friday when we got there and did not move it until we left on Monday. We walked and took the bus (which is only $3.00 for an all day pass) everywhere. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a good place to stay. ALSO--> if you are a AAA member you get 10% off your room a night. You just have to show them the card. So worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: familytravelerwith4
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel...Great location on the Boardwalk and the hotel is VERY CLEAN. The staff hotel are exceptionally NICE and HELPFUL. I will definitely stay there on my next visit to Ocean City, MD.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jaleha41121
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel every year for about 6 years. It is a great value and the location is perfect. You can park you car and walk everywhere. This year I had a death in my family and had to cancel the day before my reservation. Although I did not expect it , they mailed me back my deposit. It says alot about the character of people who run this hotel that they sent back my deposit that I was not entitled to. They have a customer for life!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: pcklpss
Reviews.Content: The Park place was a nice hotel clean and tidy is near everything on boardwalk and beach had a really great time there.

Reviews.Title: “What a shame”
Reviews.Author: TrippedReview
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Iraq (1-yr tour) and wanted to take my family out to Ocean City (Tuesday - 14 JUN) so my year and a half old son and I could play in the ocean. I found what I thought was the perfect hotel based on the number of positive comments AND the fact they offered a military discount. When I went to set the reservation online, it said a two night minimum was required and to call for availability. I called and spoke to Keisha who said I could stay the one night IF I paid the full price then said it would still require a two night minimum stay . I asked how many nights you have to stay for the weekend and she said three. Would have really liked to have given this one a try, but not anymore. Such a shame.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in OC”
Reviews.Author: MrsPoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! We stay here every year in May and this year we stayed for a few days in October. It was the best. The location is right in the heart of old downtown O.C. and near everything. The staff is very friendly. The oceanfront room is clean with a wonderful view looking out on the boardwalk, beach and ocean. Heavenly. The beds could be a bit more comfortable but I'm spoiled by Hampton Inn beds. The Connor Cafe is on premises and while the food is good it is a bit pricey. But that isn't unusual for O.C. If you stay over the beach bar expect noise. After all it is a beach bar. I put earplugs in and sleep fine. The hotel is clean, safe and friendly. I won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: krisi07041985
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. It was extremely clean, everyone was nice. The maid service was very prompt and friendly...I just don't have enough good things to say. We can't wait to come back next year...!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, decent, terrific location is key”
Reviews.Author: Thornblade
Reviews.Content: Had a good first time stay at Park Place Hotel. Location was key as it was near the south end of the boardwalk close to the amusement park. Beach is right outside, pool was ok. Parking is fine. We had no issues. Good for a week on the boardwalk. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied, relieved to have nice hotel, nothing extraordinary though”
Reviews.Author: kattyToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I , with our three year old, decided to stay here at Park Place based on the reviews. It's our first time at Ocean city, so I have nothing to compare to, but I'm happy enough to have a clean room, with clean towels and sheets. Like I said, there is nothing extra special about the hotel...the rooms do need updating, but they are clean. I found the staff very friendly and encountered absolutely no problems. I found it a bit expensive, but it is right on the boardwalk, so I guess that's a normal price. Very happy with location, elevators were slow, but what's the rush? For the price, I expected a nicer looking room, but am relieved to have a clean room with comfortable beds and pillows. Bathroom was clean too. That's all we really want. Family oriented place too, so no crazy teens running around. All in all, would stay again. Just would try to bargain for a better price:)

Reviews.Title: “Good, for the Beach, but Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: zich6
Reviews.Content: Good Relatively clean rooms, great location, guaranteed parking, deck that overlooks boardwalk and beach with rocking chairs, friendly staff with one exception, ATM in lobby. Not so good We made the reservation in June and asked that information be mailed. When we got the room rate list it showed a rate much lower than the rate we got, so I called the hotel to inquire. I was told “we only have a few months to make money and everyone does it. Besides, the rates say subject to change.” When I asked if they had yet to give the rate listed for any stay this year, I was told “no.” There is a huge difference between “subject to change” and “we have absolutely no intention of meeting the rates in our rate schedule.” This is a classic “bait and switch.” Also, “everyone” is not doing this. The hotel bills itself as “green.” Our family is greener than most. That said, my recent experience has shown that being green is an excise for some businesses to cut corners to save money. For example, the toilet was adjusted such that about a half gallon was used during the flush. The building code in most areas is 1.3 gallons. The result was that 4 flushes were required to empty the bowl. Rather than call the front desk, I adjusted it myself. Next, there was a red overhead heater connected to a wall timer. No problem so far. However, there didn’t seem to be any fan or air movement when the switch was turned on. When I called the front desk to inquire, I was told “it’s a quiet fan.” Doubting this, I took the fixture apart and discovered the reason it was quiet – there was no fan. There was a small vent in the ceiling but I couldn’t detect any air moving through it either. Without getting graphic, there is a very good reason why bathrooms typically have exhaust fans. Were these issues maintenance problems not intended by the owners? Doubtful. The result of the lack of humidity removal – green mold on the back of the sink. The shower also had peeling paint. I have never been on a smaller hotel balcony. It was about 2 feet in depth and too small for someone of average size to sit comfortably in a chair and face the ocean. While the room bathroom and shower were reasonably clean for a beach hotel the public men’s room on the 1st floor was not. It had wall paper peeling from the wall. They could do much better. As others have mentioned, a beach goer has to go through the hotel and either up the very slow elevator, or up stairs to get to a location to wash sand off. An outdoor location, like some other hotels, would help keep common areas clean. Mike, the staff member who checked us in was unnecessarily brusque. When I asked, as I always do to get the best available room, “what rooms are available,?” I was told “none.” Since we got there early and hung out until a room was open, this is highly unlikely. They just didn’t want to accommodate us. This is the first time I’ve every encountered this. If they were sold out, they should have said. Even then, since we checked in so early, we saw numerous people checking out. There had to be a choice of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “EXPECTED MORE”
Reviews.Author: brwnys
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at Park Place before but it was during an off season time. We enjoyed it then. This last time we were disappointed with a few things. One being the fact that they don't enforce their own rules. We requested a non-smoking room, ocean front. We received a room that was handicapped accessible which was okay but had stains on the walls and ceiling that appeared to be mold. I tool my allergy pills to try to ward off problems. We were on the 3rd. floor and the folks that used the sundeck overlooking the ocean directly below us were obnoxious. They took over the whole deck and all the tables. Even took a light from their room to hook onto an umbrella to play late night poker and games. Smoke......unbelievable from huge cigars and cigarettes. The smoke came right up onto our balcony that it was not pleasant to sit outside. Could not keep the door open because the smoke would come into your room. Another guest said they received a letter from the front desk saying that they were going to charge them $250.00 to clear the smoke from their room and THEY DIDN'T EVEN SMOKE. Kids were sent to the pool and acted like they owned the place...no adult supervision. Chairs were taken from the deck to the ocean so that there were no rockers to enjoy the ocean view. This was just a bad experience with people that had no regard or respect for other people that were staying at the hotel. When I mentioned this at check out the only comment I received was "we had a large party that booked together". So.......don't they have to follow rules too? Location is good. Elevators are SLOW. Parking is okay. Beds were okay, but always felt "damp" in the room. Although rooms appeared to be clean if you walked in your stocking feet in the room, they were black before you went to bed. Would I recommend? I don't know. Would I recommend the Hilton....absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is average for the price.”
Reviews.Author: esnvacation
Reviews.Content: At first arrival the hotel staff is friendly, check in was quick and painless. Once we got to our room the first thing you notice is the mildew smell of the room. Other than that the room was clean although the furniture looked a little used. The location is great for the beach, boardwalk and nightlife. The hotel was quiet for the amount of people and all guests were respectful. I would recommend the hotel if you can get a discounted rate. I don't mind paying for a hotel that has great up-keep, but at the price they could spend a little money on new mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “WE WILL BE BACK!”
Reviews.Author: Jarhead5711
Reviews.Content: My family and I really enjoyed our week at this hotel! ( Aug 7-14) The room was very clean and spacious enough for our family of 4. We had a ocean front room on the 6th - i would highly suggest paying a little extra for the view of the boardwalk and ocean. Check in took 5 min. and the staff was helpful and friendly. The only con: Parking spaces are very tight!

Reviews.Title: “Always the same -- Nice!”
Reviews.Author: PATraveler4
Reviews.Content: This is our first visit to the Ocean City area in 2 years. We decided to book at Park Place. As usual, this hotel does not change. It is well maintained, clean, pleasant. Location is convenient. The staff is always friendly and courteous. Service is efficient. Beds are comfortable. One minor problem was that one of the bedspreads had a stain--looked like it may have been a food stain, but our daughter was understandably uncomfortable. It took two requests before housekeeping changed it (typically this is not normal for this hotel). Overall, no complaints. A nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Not Fancy or New but Quiet, Clean, Convenient, Great service, and Price.”
Reviews.Author: ElecTech757
Reviews.Content: Parking is a little tough,1 spot per room, Rooms very clean (I have Allergies, no problems) Beds were very comfortable. A/C worked great had a room beside the pool, was concerned about noise from the pool. The set hours for the pool being open solved the problem and it was Very quiet. Service from the front desk was exceptional. Everything was in good working order could not have been more pleased. Right on the boardwalk & beach. Will definitly stay there again when going there for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: bigmamaflick
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Park Place Hotel. The staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful!! We had a few requests, and within minutes, they were taken care of. The location was perfect and the view was outstanding! I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We have stayed in quite a few hotels in Ocean City, but Park Place was by far the best!

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay still clean with great location”
Reviews.Author: VacaysRock
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband from July 30 to Aug 8, 2010, with no problems. This has quickly become my favorite place to stay, I love the ocean front rooms, totally private balcony & great views of the beach and boardwalk. Used the pool several times it was well maintained. Also used the washer/dryer at the hotel once during our stay, front desk even supplied me with a bounce since I forgot mine. All the employees we saw were friendly & its just an easy place to relax & enjoy a nice beach vacation. Looking forward to many return trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: Gatos47
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy about this hotel, just nice, clean place. All rooms have a refrigerator and microwave. All rooms, including balconies, are non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Jon S
Reviews.Content: 2nd stay here two years in a row and never disappointed. Great rooms, service, bar, pool and location. Last stay was given a Bay View but stunk horribly like smoke. talked to the Manager who came up to verify and we were upgraded to a Ocean View room for the same price. Only down side is Connors restaurant whose breakfast buffet is pretty lousy. All in all the Best!!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: gaurd1210
Reviews.Content: This was my family's first time in ocean city and it couldnt have been better. The hotel was amazing and right on the boardwalk. The price was average for any decent hotel in the area, and the staff was very helpful. We will definatley go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The price is amazing for it's location on the Boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: acina
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at Park Place for seven nights. The staff were friendly and helpful. They do a great job cleaning your room. Very fast. The room: It's a good place to stay if you don't plan to stay in your room for too long (while you are not sleeping). There's not much in the room. There is a coffee maker, microwave, small refrigerator, dish rack, and a few plates, bowls, cups and some silverware. They provide dish soap. I brought my own electric burner to cook on. There's PLENTY to eat on the Boardwalk though. No shortage of good food. The bathtub is great. It has jets that my kids LOVED!!! They spent lots of time in the bath. The rooms are supposedly "smoke-free," but ours smelled like old smoke. You are not supposed to smoke on the balcony either, but our neighbors did. Not all the rooms smell that way though. It's not the hotel's fault, just the ignorant guest. There is a pull-out couch that is great for the kids (or short adults). Stay on the bayside for a quieter stay. The pool: The pool is shaded for most of the morning. I have fair skin, so I liked that. Not a very big pool though. Other amenities: They have one washer and one dryer. They cost a $1 each. Not many people used it either. There's a game room, but I never went to it. There is free internet, but it can be VERY slow during busy hours. Our computer kept dropping the connection. What I liked best: The proximity of the hotel to the beach and boardwalk. What I liked least: The smoky smell of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Autumnsky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and the location is unbeatable. Despite having a room overlooking the boardwalk, we heard no noise with the sliding door closed. Most of the clientele were married couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Renech
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Park Place in an Oceanfront room. The room was a nice size with a loveseat, microwave, coffeemaker, mini-fridge and extra sink. The view from the balcony was outstanding with the hotel's terrace restaurant and bar below, and the boardwalk and beach just below that. I am pretty picky about room cleanliness and this room was spotless, even in the corners of the bathroom. The price was right - not one of the cheap (and often sketchy-looking) motels, but not at the level of some of the other big highrises along the boardwalk. The only slight negative was the force of the shower from the handheld shower head. It was sufficient, but only just. Still, that was a minor issue compared with how satisfied we were overall. We would definitely stay here again, and gladly recommend it to anyone looking for a great place to stay in O.C.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Marzilla
Reviews.Content: My husband I I took a 2 week road trip putting all of our hotel decisions in the hands of Trip Advisor. It had not steered us wrong, but when we pulled into the parking lot, I thought "oh no". BUT !! I was wrong. We were able to upgrade to a beach view room from a bay view room and thank goodness we did ! The room is everything !! The view of the beach and the boardwalk are unbeatable. Location location location !! Nice bar downstairs and everything within walking distance. Our room had a small sink, microwave, fridge, and coffee maker. In the cupboard there were some dishes along with a dish drainer and dish soap. If we ever go to Ocean City again, this is where I want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: svc2014
Reviews.Content: I traveled here with my mom and sister and stayed for a week and a half. The room was very comfortable and had everything we needed. We never ate at the hotel because we have our favorite restaurants on the boardwalk we like to go to. But the hotel is near everything you could want to be near on the boardwalk. If you aren't comfortable driving a lot on vacation, this is the perfect place to go to because you park when you arrive, and the only time you get back in your car is when you are going home. The boardwalk has everything you need, and if not there is a convenient bus service right outside the back door by the parking lot. The pool is really really small but the ocean is a short walk away. We were trying to get internet on my laptop and it wasn't working, so a staff member actually took the time to work with us over and over to get the internet to work. If you ever need something healthy and refreshing in the middle of the day, the small restaurant that is open in the hotel sells vanilla frozen yogurt with fruit. It was delicious! There is also a very nice jewelry store owned by the hotel. Very good stay, and at a great price for boardwalk/ocean front!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, clean, great price and location!!! right on the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: Nodiva10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are from VA beach as we left one beach area and traveled to another. we use to go ocean city all the time.
