We decided to take a trip up for our anniversary and im glad we stayed it this hotel. It was clean, clean, clean. Being from the beach area we wasnt expecting a big luxury room. But rather clean and great service! and thats exactly what we got. We went site seeing looking at the other hotels that we saw online and I'm glad i trusted the reviews from trip advisor and stayed at this hotel because we had orig booked at another hotel that im so glad that we cancelled. Just know that the pictures posted on their sites are not updated. Go by the reviews and not the pics.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with great view & perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: VacaysRock
Reviews.Content: First stay at Park Place, I trusted the trip advisor reviews & was very happy. I loved the location we had no problem walking to the inlet & back. We stayed in an ocean front 6th floor room, very clean, view was great of ocean, sand & boardwalk. Lots of counter space in bathroom. Nice to have the bar sink for the coffee pot outside the bathroom too. Mini fridge & microwave came in handy. I really liked the sofa, coffee table and the table with chairs in the room. We had 2 plastic chairs on the balcony to sit on & enjoy a drink while watching the boardwalk activity. I'd have to say this is the best hotel I've stayed in at Ocean City & plan on making it only this one from here on out. Also should say every employee I saw from front desk to cleaning were friendly and polite, always a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute best choice”
Reviews.Author: amw190
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an off season 2 night stay after trusting trip advisor reviews. The hotel was fantastic--great staff, perfect location, very comfortable. Minor problems were addressed right away. You can park your car and have everything you need within walking distance, which is great for a short stay. The other reviewers were absolutely right: the name brand hotels (that I saw) along the boardwalk are not nearly as nice or convenient. The jewelry store on site is lovely and the 10% guest discount is great. This was our first time to OC and we would definitely stay there again. The off season prices are a bargain. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This is the nicest hotel in ocean city...”
Reviews.Author: Cathyp83
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest hotel in ocean city!!! I was so impressed! It's right on the heart of the boardwalk! The staff is amazing and their prices are unbeatable! I will never stay anywhere else in ocean city!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, read review for the reasons.”
Reviews.Author: BornToTravel50States
Reviews.Content: First, I will say that EVERY hotel in Ocean City, Maryland is overpriced, especially in the summer. If you can get your head around that, then I think you should consider the Park Place Hotel. It is the highest rated, least expensive hotel right on the Boardwalk. If you can, reserve an oceanfront room. To me there is no point going to the beach if you can't see the beach from your room. I've stayed in the same room two summers in a row and I loved it both times. My wife is mentally disabled and the staff went out of their way to accomodate our needs. My room was big enough for a couple, or with up to two small children; if you have teenagers it might be a little tight. Yes the elevator is slow and the pool is small, but we were on the 3rd floor and took the stairs most of the time and I don't use a pool that much anyway. The mini fridge and microwave were very handy. The whole hotel is kept very clean. Good channels on the TV. Several restaurants within a short walk. Park Place is very quiet, except for when the gulls start in at 5 a.m. or if they are power spraying the benches. The balcony is narrow, about 3 1/2 feet, but is completely private, you won't be forced to talk to your neighbors. That was also important to me. The arcades and amusement parks are a few blocks away, and a bike rental one block south around the corner. I have enjoyed my stay at the Park Place both times.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean great location.”
Reviews.Author: ssman15320
Reviews.Content: If you go to Ocean City to enjoy the boardwalk then this is the place to stay. it is a very clean hotel something hard to find these days! And its location on the boardwalk is close to many boardwalk attractions. The staff is great, very polite and will do what ever they can to make your stay a good one.

Reviews.Title: “I feel like vacationing in Ocean city Again since I found this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Germaphobic
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean and orderly, staff is is very friendly , very nice furnishings in the room. this hotel is well taken care of. I usally stay at Holiday inns but this Hotel is in better condition and a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good - Crumbly Cookies and Fire Alarms Notwithstanding”
Reviews.Author: Vauban
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights over the Labor Day weekend. Two adults and three kids. Had a seaview room. Room was a reasonable size, beds comfy, and the views terrific. Room was generally clean (but someone's crumbly cookies in the sofa bed was a treat we could have done without!). The location of the hotel is excellent - right on the Boardwalk and in the heart of the action. Consequently, it was a bit noisy: so don't go for this option if you are an early/light sleeper! The fire alarm at midnight on Sunday evening was just a bit too much excitement, however ...

Reviews.Title: “Compared with what?”
Reviews.Author: MDCory
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of the top three places in OC, MD, we selected Park Place. Although we did not find it to be a four or five Trip Advisor rating, compared with many of the places we have stayed, it is probably really good compared with other OC accommodations. So, OC, maybe more than average. Overall, very average. Highlights would be the outstanding location. On the board walk, near all the honky tonk food and collectable places. Undoubtedly, the widest sandy beach in OC with lots of room to spread out. Cute bar on the second floor with nice evening specials to enjoy while watching all the people pass by. And a very, very nice staff. And parking for one car per room is included, right next to the hotel. Down side: not much in the way of amenities, very, very small and dingy pool (but refreshing to have after the beach), tiny, non-descript lobby, no bell staff that we saw or experienced, access to the beach through the restaurant or jewelry store or down a flight of stairs through the upstairs bar (a little different). No restaurant, other than maybe some space leased to Connor's Deli with a mediocre breakfast buffet and menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but lower your expectation....”
Reviews.Author: JoeFrom540
Reviews.Content: We decided last minute (within 5 days of going), that Summer wouldn't be Summer without a quick trip to O.C.. We have gone the last couple of years and have enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Ocean Front Suites... One year, we went in May and in September (better rates), and the following year we went ON LABOR day, (the rates drop like a rock on and the days following Labor Day). We absolutely LOVE the Hilton, but because our Son starts Kindergarten this year, we had to go before Labor Day, and couldn't afford the Hilton Rates. We love to stay in VERY NICE hotels, and as I said above, the Hilton is amazing. Relying on Trip Advisor to provide some guidance on an alternative, Park Place was ranked #2, and was less expensive. The previous reviews I have read boast about the clealiness of the Hotel/Rooms and some have even compared the Hotel to the Ritz!!!! REALLY???? I don't think so. While the location was PERFECT, the hotel itself was just average. The room was CLEAN, but for $270 it better be.... We wanted to enjoy the pool when we got there, as our room wasn't ready yet. (We arrived WELL BEFORE CHECK-IN), but the Hotel staff, which was very nice, have us a key to the pool and the changing/rest rooms. The pool was small, but clean. The changing rooms were small, hot, smelly, and disgusting.... We will not stay there again, and would rather spend the extra $$ for the Hilton next time.. Our room at Park Place was a Bay View, the Ocean View would have been about 35 bucks more. The Hilton, although more expensive, has ALL OCEAN Front Rooms... Separate living/sleeping areas, two large flat screens, full fridge, stove, etc... (Man, the more I write this, the more I am upset that we just didn't cough up the extra money.) Let me some up some of the other things you may have read in other reviews.. 1.) Room - Clean (average). Ritz like (uh....NO). 2.) Elevator - Slow, long waits 3.) Location - PERFECT!!! 4.) Parking - Yes, the spots are small, but we never had a problem. 5.) Pool - SMALL, clean, on the West Side of the hotel. 6.) Staff - Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay with clean room”
Reviews.Author: NYCRonnie
Reviews.Content: This was a spur of the moment trip and we wanted to book a room with an oceanfront view. I was pleased that the room was very clean and the hotel was clean also. The couch in the room was not so comfortable. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. The oceanfront patio was very nice, we had an excellent view of the beach and the boardwalk. The pool was standard hotel size and very clean. The entire family enjoyed our stay in Ocean City and at the Park Place hotel

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: askye05
Reviews.Content: We picked this place after researching many hotels. We made the right choice. We could not have been happier. We arrived early for an activity we had booked. The hotel allowed us to park prior to checking in. Every staff member we encountered was very friendly. We had a small problem with out refrigerator when we arrived. The issue was resolved immediately (within minutes!!) Our room was clean, spacious and had a spectacular view of the ocean and boardwalk. This is a wonderful hotel operated by people who care about the comfort of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Everything you need within distance.”
Reviews.Author: tshaner329
Reviews.Content: I am a very picky person when it comes to hotels and I would definitely stay again. The rooms were clean and my family of four fit comfortably in the room. The front desk and staff were all very friendly and the location of the hotel is one of the best. We had a bayside room and would recommend it to anyone, but beware if staying on the 2nd floor oceanview side, you may have the outdoor cafe and bar view instead of the ocean. And one of the best features was that I could not hear the people above or next door to us. The rooms were actually sound proof, which is hard to come by in OC.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikpaman
Reviews.Content: great hotel,extremely clean,love no smoking in whole hotel,not smelly,great location,pool small but works and very clean

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovinvaca70
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about staying at Park Place because we normally stay at the upper scale hotels, but I wanted a hotel on the board walk. After much thought and research we decided to stay at Park Place. We truly enjoyed our stay the hotel is very clean and we had no noise problems. It is in the mains section of the board walk and sits by the widest part of the beach. We had a great stay and all our needs were taken care of. The pool is small, but who needs a pool when you have an entire ocean. I would recommend this hotel and stay there a again. Kudos to the hotel! After we got there, we were glad we did not pick some of other hotels we looked at.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, great location, friendly staff!!”
Reviews.Author: carsmama
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 15 minutes after check-in time and the room was ready. Friendly staff at check-in, as well. The room was very clean, and just as described, including a refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker, small sink, a few dishes, dish soap, dishcloth and towel. We had a sixth floor bayview room, and were not disturbed at night by any noise. The balcony was nice and we could indeed see the bay in the distance. Maid service was prompt every morning, and the staff was very accommodating, coming back later as promised when we weren't quite ready for them to clean. The pool is not very large, but again, very clean - we saw them vacuuming it in the morning. We did not eat at the cafe, but they do have good Margaritas at the 2nd floor deck bar. The hotel has a great location on the boardwalk and was very easy to get to. Parking was always available, but be aware that the spaces are very tight. All in all, a great hotel. A little pricey compared to some of the others but given the location, cleanliness and amenities included I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay at the best part of the boardwalk.”
Reviews.Author: Sterling123
Reviews.Content: This is the best place we've found to stay ON the boardwalk be right where all the action is on the boardwalk. We got an ocean front view room, and weren't disappointed. The deck is small but sweet. You see the ocean as well as everyone on the boardwalk-- a picturesque view. You can even see people eating at Connor's, the hotel's 2nd story bar and restaurant. It's a nice place for a drink or meal, overlooking the action. The room is like a small suite. You get a sofa in which you can see the view. You get a little kitchenette with fridge, microwave, china and silverware. Everything in the room looks new and all was very clean. The hallways, the lobby, the elevators-- everything is new and clean. There is an outdoor pool, though a little small. It gets crowded with 6 or 7 other people in it. But it's clean and nice, with restrooms right there. We've found that in the sweet spot of the boardwalk where this is, most hotels have no pool, and those that do don't have a bigger pool than this. Elevators worked well, though of two elevators, only one goes to the parking lot ground level-- remember which one. Service all around was great. The parking lot was never full in mid July, so we could be away from other cars if we chose. Absolutely nothing to dislike here, and everything to like. It's a bit pricey to be here in high season, but after shopping around, we found this to be the best choice to be right in the middle of the best of the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ,clean and will be back”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELSHERIUSA
Reviews.Content: we really liked the location of this hotel,right on the boardwalk.My mother in law who is older went loved it along with my partner.i think it will need some refurbishing soon like in the bathroom and sofa but over all it was clean and our room attendent YOLANDA was awesome!I was told no groups of young people were allowed but the day before we were to leave a group of 4 guys like 21 or 22 checked in and were drinking on the beach and just being loud on the balcony .I was kinda annoyed since i was asked my age when i booked and these college fools crashed the hotel.all in all we will be back but hope to see some new furnishings and no young groups!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!-We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: chickypoo021
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family and it was absolutely amazing. We got there and the staff was so friendly, but they make you sign a paper stating that you cannot get henna tattoos because they stain the sheets. When we got to our room you could smell that there was a smoking room nearby when we got into the room is was absolutely stunning. It looked like we were staying at the Ritz-Carlton! It is located right on the boardwalk and near the hustle and bustle. We chose the bayside, you can see the bay and the bridge but you also have the other houses to look at too. Next time if we go I would definitely choose the ocean side room. The pool was very clean and closed at 10. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a good clean stay with younger kids!

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: MominVirginia
Reviews.Content: I just spent a weekend at this hotel. I picked this hotel based on its location and that it was ranked so high here. While the hotel is fine, I honestly cannot understand at all how it can be ranked so high here. There is nothing special or unique about this hotel. The hotel has very little amenities. There is an outside pool in the back (so it doesn't face the water), and that's about it. They have a nice deck facing the water that serves food and drinks, but it's not covered so it's only good when the weather is nice. It rained all day our first day, so I came to appreciate how imporant these things can be! The hotel staff is friendly but not very knowledgeable when it comes to the area. I asked questions about different places, and they just didn't seem to know the answers. The hotel rooms are fine but the bathrooms are kind of small, and the tub seemed particularly small! The best thing about the hotel is its location (right near the action), and the drinks on the deck were great! I wouldn't recommend this hotel for families because there were so many people getting drunk on the deck and outside the hotel at night!! Last year we stayed a week at the Holiday Inn Suites Hotel further up the boardwalk. That hotel is more expensive and not as close to the action but it was wonderful! It has a great outside pool facing the ocean (and you can get food and drinks by the pool) and the rooms are very large!! (and they have much nicer balconies). I would definitely recommend it over this one for families and people looking for a nicer place to stay. If you really want to be near all the action, though, this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel = great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: boostingwrx12
Reviews.Content: i booked my vacation on may 28th. stayed there for 3 nights. all i can say is wow! great hotel & great location. clean hotel and friendly staff. lots of parking. i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “They banned us from the hotel for their mistakes!”
Reviews.Author: fitchfamof5
Reviews.Content: My family stayed there Labor Day weekend 2008 and we had numerous problems. We brought our concerns to the managers' attention and assumed all was resolved. We tried to make another reservation this year and to my surprise was told, "We prefer not to have you stay here again." and then I was hung up on. We complained about roaches in the room that they claim were crickets. The only other thing we complained about was the noise of the pool door slamming causing our children (10yrs, 7yrs and 7 months old) to be awakened in the middle of the night. It really amazes me that we had valid, reasonable complaints that have now caused us to be banned from their establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, we'd highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: tw1tch
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Park Place based on the reviews on TripAdvisor and we're very glad that we did. The room was clean, spacious, and flawlessly maintained by the hotel's housekeeping staff. The staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful, allowing us to keep our car in their lot for a few hours after we'd checked out. The location can't be beaten, as it's right on the bottom end of the boardwalk. Best of all, we could actually see the bay from our bayview room, which we were skeptical about. We'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ceshell
Reviews.Content: My family had been to Ocean City MD several times but never stayed here before the summer of 2008. Every other place we stayed at was dirty, run down, rude staff etc.. I booked at Park Place based on the reviews here and we were so glad we did. The location is great, right on the boardwalk. Parking was no hassle at all, plenty of room in the lot, the mgmt. was awesome. We ate at the on-site restaurant, food was great. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to stay in OC !”
Reviews.Author: vickibair
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I have been staying at Park Place for years now, when we visit Ocean City, MD. It feels like our home away from home. They make you feel so welcome. The service is excellent. The staff always have a smiling face for you. I felt I just had to take the time & write this review. I've been in Customer Service for 20 years, and I have to tell you, you won't be sorry you stayed here. I get e mails all the time from other OC hotels, and honestly I just delete them. The location is perfect, the views are perfect, free pc in the lobby to check your e mail, free wireless internet, and the price is very fair. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We Stayed At In OC”
Reviews.Author: Tbella27
Reviews.Content: We have been taking our annual family vacation to OC for many years and we have tried several hotels. We have finally found one that we return to every year, Park Place! I love this hotel because it is close to everything, they have a restaurant and a bar on property, and their rooms are clean and roomy. Now, the bad....I don' t like that they lock the front entrance, making you walk in a dark back alley to get back in after a certain hour. They should allow at least their guests to enter the front. And the front desk staff is not friendly, they do not make you feel like a welcomed guest, actually they make you feel more of a bother. However, this doesn't prevent us from returning year after year, we just hope that they hire a better staff by our next trip. The cost of their rooms are much higher than the rest but I have never been one to stay somewhere less expensive instead of staying somewhere where I want to be. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone visiting OC!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MDlover
Reviews.Content: Went to OC this past weekend. We had stayed at Park Place two years ago in the fall. The location is perfect! Right on the Boardwalk, overlooking the ocean. The room was nice, small micro, mini fridge, little coffee maker, etc. The bathroom was a good size. Although it may need some updating in the near future. Wasn't dirty at all, just worn looking. The complimentary soaps were Bath & Bodyworks. The view was incredible... got some great sunrise photos! The sofabed was not comfortable to sit on, the cushions were at an angle backward. Just on that I would guess the bed isn't very comfortable when pulled out. My biggest complaint was the bed... just wasn't comfortable and didn't sleep well. However, the staff was very friendly and helpful! We needed to print out our boarding passes for our flight the next day. They have a complimentary computer in the lobby, but no printer. But the manager printed out our passes and was happy to do so. The jewelry store attached that faces the Boarkdwalk has some nice pieces, plus you get an extra 10% discount if you stay at the hotel. The hotel was clean, which is a definite plus! In the off season some places can look very run down and dingy, not Park Place. Since we didn't need to leave OC for BWI until 1:00 and it was off season, late check out was no problem. Although when we went back to the room after 11, our key card wouldn't let us in, so we had to go back down to the front desk, just a minor glitch. We are considering staying there in the summer due to the cleanliness and location, hopefully the bed will be more comfortable then. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “We loved our time there”
Reviews.Author: PhillyDad
Reviews.Content: Clean, Clean, Clean!!!!! My wife and son along with myslef stayed at this hotel leading up to the Labor Day holiday. This was our third time spending our vacation in Ocean City Maryland and we had a fantastic time. The staff was very friendly and parking was not an issue. Checking in and out was both effiecent and pleasent. We had a bay veiw room which was fanstasic very clean and neat. One of the things we did enjoy was our room was directly over the pool which they clean each morning that we were there. If you have to have someone clean your room ask for Pam. She was very nice and any problems were taken care of immediately. A big thank you to Pam. Some of the places you have to try if you have never been to Ocean City is Fishers Popcorn it is the best on the Boardwalk and worth every penny. Also, go to the end of the peir and try out the shopping and the amusement peir. Now when your done there head over to Anthony beer and wine it is located on 33rd and Coastal Highway the reason is simple this is the place to go to get the best and i mean the BEST sandwiches in all of Ocean City but be prepare to wait as they make your sandwiches fresh and if your on a diet forget about it. and finally make sure you stop at Hall's, Ember's and Phillips for all you can eat buffets. They are all worth spending your money and time there.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay-Looks Clean-Smells Clean-Is Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Lookin4TheBeach
Reviews.Content: Our very first trip to OC MD. Will stay Park Place Again!! I looked at MANY hotels on-line - after reading all the reviews I went with Park Place becasue so many said it was clean. They lived up to the reputation!! Clean is VERY important to me. I think there is nothing worse than having to sleep in some nasty, moldy, stinky hotel. I don't care how much cheaper it is...it is not worth any amount of $$ to subject my family to mold, mildew, bacteria, germs, etc...and that is what you get when you stay in a hotel that doesn't care about clean. Our room was always fresh, the halls, the elevator, and pool were always clean. What impressed me was how often I saw someone vaccuming the halls. It must be a CHALLENGE to manage all the sand, water, moisture, etc, when you are located right on the beach!! We visited other hotels along the shore (Comfort Inn and Days INN) and they do NOT do a good job managing this. They stink! Park Place must have a better ventillation system or something to keep the moisture factor down. The other hotels carpet in the elevators and hall smelled mildewy and we saw black mold on the ceilings - Gross! So, if you are looking for clean and fresh, Park Place is it. Also, OUTSTANDING location! Noise was not a factor at all. We had friends staying down around 17th-21st who told us 2nd-3rd street was too close to all the noise of the boardwalk and that we would hate it...WRONG! Not a problem at all. In fact, it is a bonus because we enjoyed our quick walk to the boardwalk and they had to hike a long way or pay for the trolly car. I will stay here again. All the staff was VERY friendly and helpful not rude or discourteous at all! Keep it up!!

Reviews.Title: “Off-Season fun”
Reviews.Author: Penna3
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a extra long off-season weekend in OC. Made our reservations at Park Place several weeks ago based on the feedback here and it lived up to all of our expectations. The hotel was very clean and the staff especially attentive. Our 4th floor (of 6 floors) rooms had a great view of the ocean and the boardwalk. Yet when the little one was ready for bed we closed the balcony door and curtain and the room was dark and quiet. The two double beds were comfortable for someone accustomed to a firmer mattress and the crib provided by the hotel was clean and safe (hotel management provided brand and model info so we could check out info in advance before deciding not to bring our own portable unit). The hotel cafe food we had was good and you are within walking distance to several other highly rated restaurant options. We are already discussing our plans for next year and did not have to consider where to stay as we definitely plan to return to Park Place. We would highly recommend this hotel for a stay on the OC Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and relaxing times at the Park Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: BMB1
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel on Monday, September 1, 2008. Was staying there until Friday, so had 4 nights to enjoy. We got to the property an hour before check in time, and our 6th floor oceanfront balcony room was ready. My husband and I immediately went to check out our room. It was very nice. It had all the amenities that we needed and that were advertised. My husband is a hard person to please, and right away he loved the room. It had a small kitchenette area with micro,coffee maker, dishes,utensils, mini refridge,etc. Also a sofa and a small 2 seat dining table. The balcony was the highlight of the room. Spacious and private. Great view to the ocean and boardwalk. There were 2 chairs outside in the balcony area. The room was clean and every morning we went out, the room got done right away. The hotel is in a perfect location. Its right on 2nd St. In the middle of all kinds of shops,bars,and restaurants. I'm really glad we stayed in that area. The hotel also had a small pool, which I only used once and it was nice and refreshing. Lots of lounge chairs around. The parking lot was huge and was able to find a good spot. If you forget your laptop, they have a complimentary computer for the guests, right by the front desk. My husband and I found our favorite hang out spot....It was on the 2nd floor of the hotel, Conner's Sail Loft Bar....It was a cool bar with a tropical feel to it. The bar overlooked the boardwalk/beach and it was great enjoying a nice cold drink and looking at the ocean. We went there quite a bit for drinks and happy hour. Happy hour had some great specials....$3 Coronas and $2 margaritas(delicious by the way and I'm not a big margarita drinker). The prices of the drinks were reasonable too. The food was delicious too. My all time favorite was the Imperial crab bisque soup.....You must try it....Its excellent! Had some sandwiches,burgers,and wraps too. The staff there included Kevin, Anthony,Chad,and Billy, to name a few, who went above and beyond to make our stay as pleasurable as it could be. Being that this was our first time in Ocean City Maryland I was very happy with our vacation pick. The beaches were super clean and so was the boardwalk. The hotel and its location was excellent. The weather was beautiful and sunny everyday. I would definitely return to Ocean City and definitely come back to the Park Place. I would like to say that I also picked this hotel because of the Tripadvisor reviews. I have been a member for many years and trust a lot of the reviews. Great pick!

Reviews.Title: “loved the view!!!”
Reviews.Author: kelseysbutter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Park Place aug 2-9 and what a nice vacation. Couldn't ask for nicer maid service, location or a more spectactular view of the sun coming up in the morning. Refrigerator was just big enough, gotta love the bath and body works in the bathroom, the beds were not even uncomfortable like most hotels, everything was great!! The pool is a little small but we didn't really come for the pool anyway. Can't wait to stay next year. My famiy has been staying at Park Place for sometime and will continue to do so.. The only negative part is trying to order food at the walk up counter. Orders were continuously messed up everytime. Finally just decided to stop trying to order from there. Park Place Jewelers is a major plus!!! Definately has one of the best locations on the Boardwalk. Easy access to everything... HELGA AND OLGA actually wrote notes back and forth to my daughter!! They were the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Just got back...”
Reviews.Author: crabcakes
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and very clean. Close to everything. Enjoyed the Sail Loft bar. Bartender a tad stressed out. Maybe she needs more help. Breakfast buffet at Conners was kind of weird. Eggs were served in big huge dry chunks. Would go elsewhere for breakfast. Kids said they could feel the springs in the pull-out bed. Double beds fine. But will say they could invest in new pillows! Overall nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: GPQuinn
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Park Place for three days with my wife and our 6 year old daughter. The hotel was clean and well maintained. The service staff were pleasant and the front desk was helpful recommending attractions and providing directions. My daughter loved the pool and the access to the beach and boardwalk was very convenient. The room was on the top floor with an ocean view...great view of the beach, water and boardwalk, and surprisingly quiet with the balcony door shut. The hotel location is great...it is close to the amusements but not right on top of them...still right in the heart of the boardwalk with many nearby shops and restaurants. Overall, we were pleased with the hotel, the staff and the location...would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Spotlessly Clean”
Reviews.Author: MrsPine
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Ocean City before, so we selected this hotel based upon positive ratings by this site, Froemmers. and AAA. We wanted to be right on the boardwalk to see what this town is all about. The Park Place is probably the cleanest hotel that I have ever stayed in. Not only were the rooms kept impeccably clean, but workers were constantly sweeping, mopping and wiping down everything in the common areas (lobby, poolside, and deck/bar areas) every day. The family that owns this hotel has been operating on this site for over 100 years, and they have their act down! We had a slight problem with our internet connection that was quickly fixed. Otherwise, we had no problems at all. We booked at the last minute and had to settle for a 2nd floor oceanfront room, which does not have a private balcony, but rather opens up to the common deck area adjacent to the bar. We were not crazy about the lack of privacy, but it turned out OK - easy access to the beach and lobby without the need for the elevator, and it was nice to just walk out of our room and get a drink just steps away. If we stay there again, however, we'll try for an upper floor so we can have some privacy and keep the screen door open at night. We ate at the downstairs restaurant (Connor's) one night, and I do not recommend the food there - our quesadillas were served burnt, and the whole dinner (crab cakes, fries, etc) tasted and smelled of rancid oil. There are other, better restaurants within walking distance. This hotel cannot be beat for the prime boardwalk location, clean rooms and on-the-ball staff.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Gus324
Reviews.Content: We had a nice family vacation here. On the boardwalk and close to all the stuff kids love-arcades, rides and games. Good restaurants all walking distance (love the Italian restaurant Da Vinci's). Definitely an older hotel-but very clean and the people working there were friendly. Would not advise eating at thier cafe for breakfast-not good and too expensive for what you get. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Park Place - Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: imbullgod
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights July 29-Aug 1, 2008. Hotel was not fully booked, as the vacancy sign was on. Very nice place. Fast check-in. We paid for an oceanfront room - beautiful view! But doesn't come cheap. Very clean, great maid service! Good happy hours during the week with special drink prices! Bar overlooks the boardwalk/ocean. There's a Subway sandwich shop next door. We ate at Dough Rollers for one breakfast and one dinner...excellent service and food! Also, we always go to Melvin's Steakhouse when we stay in OC. This time we could walk there... Our car never left the parking lot all week! We loved the location of this place. Our only complaints would be that the outdoor pool is too small (no indoor pool) and our room was not very large for my husband, myself and our 2 teenage sons.... but we managed. We stayed on the 6th floor (top), the 2 elevators worked fine. Beds/mattress just ok, not Sweet Sleepers like the Sheraton has. Always fresh bedding provided by maid service, they were the best. Will return next year!

Reviews.Title: “loved it :)”
Reviews.Author: naughtynurse27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the pph from 8/1-8/4, our room was a double oceanfront effic, and we had an incredible view of the ocean and the boardwalk. I was really impressed with the housekeeping, they kept the room spotless, even with my 2 kids dragging sand in from the beach, and loved the bath and body works products that were in the bathroom. I was VERY happy with pph, and am planning to book it again for 2009, only this time i would stay a couple more days....it was a little pricey, but definitley worth it, this was our 1st vacation in a few years. LOVED IT, and am very satisfied :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Great location”
Reviews.Author: SINYGuy
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical in staying in a hotel on the boardwalk but I must say I had a great time. The hotel was clean and modern and the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The pool was a little on the small side, but either way I am not really a pool person. The access from the hotel right to the boardwalk was very convenient. Everything was within walking distance. I would not hesitate at all to return. For a shore hotel you can't go wrong

Reviews.Title: “See you in 2009!”
Reviews.Author: MambaCat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our 5 night stay at the Park Place Hotel. After reading the reviews on here, I wasn't surprised that we really enjoyed the hotel and plan to book again next year. The room was a little on the small side, but it was just enough for my husband and I. The mini-kitchen was really nice, albeit small, and helped us save money by eating in a few times. You cannot beat the location if you want to be right on the boardwalk and close to the pier. Our room faced the bay/parking lot and I was a little worried about noise from the neighboring hotels and some construction. However, once we were in for the night we didn't hear a peep from outside. The staff was friendly and willing to go the extra mile to help us when we couldn't get our wireless internet working. As for the cleanliness of the room/bathroom, I was very satisfied. The deck bar was great! The food and drinks were yummy and the wait staff friendly. It was nice to sit on the deck and relax at night while people watching. The breakfast buffet was ok, nothing to write home about though. The only cons I could think of were the small pool and the quality of the pillows (rather deflated/lumpy).

Reviews.Title: “An OK Choice”
Reviews.Author: mymom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Place for three nights in July 08. The hotel is newer (6 yrs old). The beds were of average quality as were the fixtures in the room. Nothing fancy here. But the room was large enough to fit two doubles, a sofa bed, a small table, a small refrigerator, a safe and microwave. The bathroom is pretty small and has really bad ventilation - no exhaust fan. I really have trouble with shore hotels that are not clean, but this one was OK. There was a little bit of mold in the bathroom and the choice of black grout on the floor tiles is sort of odd, but the toilet, tub and linens were all clean. The housekeepers are very sweet - all students from Russia and they can't do enough for the guests. Our room was supposed to overlook the bay (we booked at the last minute and nothing was available on the ocean side) and it was a pretty poor view. You are really overlooking a couple of commercial garbage bins, other hotels, the pool and the parking lot. When you sit out on the very small balcony it was really, really noisy. The air conditioner units for all the hotels are just amazingly loud. But we bought coffee in the morning and went to the public deck on the other side of the hotel overlooking the boardwalk which was very nice. A pleasant surprise was how quiet the room was. We could not hear any outside or interior noise. Great soundproofing! The pool looked nice but is very small - really great for small kids - our teenagers were not interested. The deepest part is 4 feet. One thing that was really odd was the small room on the left on the 2nd floor as guests walk into the hotel from the boardwalk. It contained some restaurant stuff, computers, slushy machines, mops and cleaning supplies and was really filthy. The floor, the counters, the odor - everything was a real turn off. Needless to say, we never ate in the restaurant at the hotel. We didn't have any trouble getting on site parking, which was helpful. And there are plenty of places to grab meals right near the hotel. The hotel is near the southern end of the boardwalk, really close to the amusement parks, arcades, Ripley's, etc. It is busy and noisy, so if you don't like that kind of stuff you need to go further north. The beach was right across the boardwalk, several steps from the hotel. We can recommend Kohr's and Dumsers on the boardwalk for ice cream, Sneaky Pete's on the bay for crabs and seafood, Piezano's for pizza, Anthony's for an awesome roast beef sandwich (they are huge) and the Fractured Prune for the oddest donuts you will ever eat. We also liked the Thriller boat ride, took a side trip to Assateague to see the ponies which was really terrific, and went to Berlin which was an interesting break on a cloudy afternoon (if you go, make sure you wander into JJ Fish Gallery and the General Store.) Overall, the Park Place is an OK choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wowowowowowow”
Reviews.Author: KWiz13
Reviews.Content: Decided to try OCMD this year and with a 5 mo. old, didnt want to skimp on cleanliness but had to watch prices. Researched about 20 hotels and decided on PPH. SO GLAD!!!! The place is just as the webpage shows!!! Unlike my other final 3 choices as I walked by to compare....My family was very pleased with location,amenities and service! Do yourself a favor, stop searching now...go stay at PPH !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Park Place”
Reviews.Author: JG5CentralNJ
Reviews.Content: I would just like to thank Park Place Hotel for a great vacation. We not only had a great room, which was very spacious and very clean for my family of 5, but also had great weather. The beach was hot, the ocean was cold but the Park Place pool was just right. My kids loved it! I would definately go back. I miss the $2 margaritas at Conner's happy hour. The hotel is in a perfect location on the boardwalk. When we booked the room back in February we had a streetview room and was put on a wait list to be upgraded to an oceanfront room. As soon as one opened up the hotel called us direct and we made the changes. The view is worth the couple extra dollars. This is a must stay if you are going to OC MD. JG5 from NJ

Reviews.Title: “not bad stay”
Reviews.Author: generaX
Reviews.Content: For the price that I paid staying in the ocean front property I expected the hotel to be nicer than it was. Pros: Room ready as promised, Parking available, on boardwalk. Cable with lots to watch. Pool is clean. Internet access, room is decent size. Cons: You can hear people in other rooms talking - there's something wrong with the room design- Not great when trying to relax. Shower was not great for my taste. In the Morning there is cleanup on the boardwalk with lots of noise from blowers and cleanup machines. No table on balcony I would not book again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel! True to its reviews”
Reviews.Author: AmericanInFrance
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on OC Md hotels, we chose this hotel, and it lived up to the reviews. The best parts are that there is a pool, on the city/bay side (which is just as well - and it had a roomy deck compared to most shore pools), and a nice deck and bar area on the ocean side. We couldn't get an ocean view room, but our bay (city) side room was fine since it was easy enough to go out on the deck that overlooked the boardwalk and beach. The rooms were a good size, beds were good, bathroom was clean and in good condition, TV with cable, etc. There was a small fridge, as well as coffee machine and coffee fixings were even provided. It was in a good location on the boardwalk. And, while it may be more pricey than some hotels, I have no complaints and think it is a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “OC Favorite”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirl789
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend at the Park Place. We absolutely loved it. Our room was immaculate. The staff was very friendly. We loved the patio bar during the day. Frozen drinks are great and you can take them right to the pool only a couple of feet away. I have been to OC Md a million times and this by far was my favorite hotel. My husband and I, decided we will only stay here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful view!”
Reviews.Author: sykesy116
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend the Park Place Hotel for a stay in Ocean City. The hotel in centrally located right on the boardwalk, has free parking, a heated pool, game room, and a deck bar and restaurant. Check-in was easy and we were able to get in to the room before the posted time.The staff was friendly and room service wasn't overly expensive and was prompt. The lobby area and hallways are well-maintained. The room was clean and seemed new. In addition to the usual furnishings, there was a sofa and coffee table and a kitchenette with a sink, refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot, and many of the amenities of your kitchen at home. The toiletries offered were the same Bath & Body Works scents I have at home. Our room had a balcony overlooking the boardwalk, beach and ocean, which added to the overall ambience of the room. I will recommend Park Place to others and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TLM323
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a 4 Night Stay at the Park Place Hotel and we LOVED it! We had never been to Ocean City, MD before ... so we chose this hotel based strictly on the reviews. We had a wonderful vacation! The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, and our Oceanfront Room (w/Balcony) was AMAZING!!! The staff was also very friendly & helpful. The hotel is in a fantastic location. We would definitely stay here again, and we would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends & family. Our only slight complaint was the "Buffet Breakfast" ... the set-up was very odd (you have to reach your hand into the back of a very hot, covered, serving pan to get to 1/2 of the items on the buffet, and we found it truly hard to avoid steam burns! When we mentioned our "burns" to our waitress, she said "when we turn the heat down, people complain that the food is cold!") ... so, we think, it's time for them to invest in a new buffet table! Beyond that minor issue, this is truly a GREAT PLACE TO STAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chases_MomVirginia
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the nicest hotels that we've stayed at in Ocean City. Our family visits OC a few times during the summer months and this was our first stay at Park Place. We will be going back many times. We had an Ocean Front Deck Room, that I highly recommend if you are traveling with children. The rooms were a nice size and the effeciency was very nice to have. The deck overlooked the boardwalk and from the deck you can access the bar/roof top restaurant as well as the boardwalk. There were rocking chairs, lounge chairs and tables with umbrellas. The pool was also very nice and heated! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We had to call and change our reservations a few times as well as the specifics of the room we wanted, but each time the staff was freindly and helpful! I give this hotel very high ratings. The only downside is the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travel9374
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this place. On the board walk and close to all action on the board walk. They have a heated outdoor pool. Staff was very courteous. Breakfast not included, wih they did. There is a restaurant by the lobby. The room was very clean and had a microwave, fridge, plates, cups, utensils and even dish soap with a sink to wash your dishes. Very spacious and clean room with couch. A bit on the expensive side but Higly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Park Place - best hotel on the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: kimm24seven
Reviews.Content: I travel to Ocean City at least twice a year. I've stayed in condos and other hotels along Coastal Highway, but this particular hotel has always been the cleanest and most modern in my experience. My teen nieces were able to have some level of independance because my sister and I could keep an eye on them from the oceanfront balcony. They could walk to arcades and restaurants and check in within a few steps. Anyone who stays at the beach knows that the moist atmosphere can cause the rooms to have a stale or mildew like odor...not so at Park Place...fresh, clean and very good prices. Some of the older, more established hotels need to ask the management what they are doing.

Reviews.Title: “We are going back!”
Reviews.Author: Vickidoll
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided to take our two boys for 6 nights. We have never been on a better vacation! The room was the perfect size (we stayed in an ocean front 2 bed, plus pull-out) The kitchenette was a money saver! Also, the maid service was impecable! We dragged in so much sand, and I felt a little guitly, but you would never know it! The pool was perfect, never crowded, even though there was TONS of familes there! We were steps aways from the beach. The one thing that I wasn't crazy about was breakfast served in the in-house restaurant. The other offerings were good, and the smoothies were a treat! Yes, the elevator was slow, we took the stairs, it helped work off all the ice cream that we ate! : )

Reviews.Title: “Well Run and Clean with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lsb040
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at Park Place Hotel since they opened in 2000 and returned for the Labor Day week of 9/1-8/2007. Over the years, we have stayed in many different hotels in Ocean City, but return to few. As has been our experience in the past, Park Place Hotel is both well run and maintained, being family owned and operated (see the pictures in the lobby - and if you've read anything about the history of Ocean City, you'll recognize the Connor name). For doubters like BALT04, I assure you that my review is not written by a member of the hotel, but a customer who has returned due to having a good experience at this hotel. The rooms are not luxurious, but you're not at an All Inclusive in Mexico - you're in Ocean City, MD and you're paying a very moderate rate for a fantastic location at a clean and well managed hotel. The Park Place Hotel is probably one of the best deals in OC. The rooms are of a decent size and somewhat basic, but comfortable, and include a sofa. As a returning customer, I can tell you that with every return, we notice improvements to the property. Since our last stay (it's been 2 years since we couldn't get in during the time we wished to stay last year), they've tiled the entrance in the room and they added a washer and dryer for the customers near the pool. The staff is pleasant and professional, which is a welcome departure from what we encountered at similarly priced hotels in OC. We always arrive extremely early and register, and the front desk staff takes our cell phone number and calls us when our room is early, which is really helpful. This spares you from feeling a nuisance by checking back. We've never encountered any housekeeping or maintenance problems at Park Place Hotel. We've never seen any mold, had any leaks or malfunctioning appliances or plumbing. In short, while there may be more luxurious or larger rooms to be had in Ocean City, many are exorbitantly priced and people who stay there may be disappointed at what they get for their money ... if you pay a lot, you expect a lot. I believe the great ratings and reviews earned by Park Place is representative of the reasonable rates charged for a property that is clean, decent and owner operated ... all of which compares favorably to other properties .... even the glitzy new spots. If you want lavish, be prepared to pay for it elsewhere. If you're at all value conscious and want clean, quiet, basic and well run, you'll be happy at the Park Place Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Question about reviews-place is average but not great”
Reviews.Author: BALT04
Reviews.Content: I find it very difficult to believe that most the reviews are not being written by someone at the motel. There is NO way that this motel is the 2nd best in Ocean City! After reviewing the postings for this place and comparing them to the posting of a few other places in Ocean City there seems to be a similiarty in many of them--everything is always "excellent" but other motels get really varied reviews. The place and staff are good.... but they are not great and they are not, by any means, 2nd in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay!!! Clean freaks this is the place for you !!”
Reviews.Author: NOOPY
Reviews.Content: My mom and I just got back from a 3 day stay at the Park Place Hotel in Ocean City Md. The location is excellent...It is located directly on the boardwalk/oceanfront! The view from our ocean front room was great! You can relax on your balcony and people watch the boardwalk too! The ENTIRE hotel is super clean ! The room was fresh,clean and decorated in soothing shades of green. The furniture while not fancy is very nice and clean appearing. The bath was large and had plenty of fresh WHITE new appearing towels.They also offer you fine quality toiletries. The carpet was also very clean and passed the "white sock test" The kitchen area ... a sink,fridge and micro was very clean and a nice touch! You would be hard pressed to find anything wrong with this hotel. You can tell they care about cleanliness through out the hotel. No filth to be found here ! We felt good about staying here. All the staff we encountered was friendly and gracious... a rare quality these days. My only minor quibble was that I could hear the music from the bar whilst I was on my balcony and in my room. It wasn't loud BUT I really wanted quiet so I asked to move. The clerk was very good about this and moved me quickly to a higher, further away room. Problem solved ! In closing we liked this hotel so much we plan on making this a our OC Md. regular hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jerzejoe1
Reviews.Content: Very clean and quiet. Excellent location. This comfortable place has it all. A bar on the outside deck; overlooking the boardwalk, a restaurant, with carry out and room service, a nice pool, a washer/ dryer ( for a buck and it's clean and works well ). Very pleasant staff. You try this place once and you'll become a regular, like me.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back next year”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyBeachbums4
Reviews.Content: Arrived 8/26/07, stayed 3 nights. Excellent time. We booked an oceanfront room, which was very clean. Our room overlooked the outside deck bar, which I thought would be a problem, but you couldn't hear a thing at night. The mornings were beautiful; just open the slider and step out onto the balcony. Rooms clean, service good. Bar staff very friendly. We had no complaints. Elevator to the GR was a little slow, but we only used it when checking out. Dough Roller was good for breakfast. DaVincis Italian Restaurant on 15th great. Stay away from the 48th Street All You Can Eat Seafood Buffet. Gross!!! It's in a banquet hall. The price was $27.99 adult, 17.99 child. All seafood was overcooked. Just gross. Jolly Rogers Speedworld was great. Ripley's museum fun. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Same great service!”
Reviews.Author: Pgh-vacationers
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from OC, MD. This is now our second year staying at Park Place. Service is consistent -- the staff is courteous and helpful. The hotel is well maintained and clean. A family-friendly hotel and a great location on the Boards.

Reviews.Title: “On the Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: weidjo
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights with our two teens. Ocean view, 4th floor, overlooking boardwalk. Perrhps a bit small four 4 people but we were outside most of the time. Great location. Room clean. Good service. Left a wallet in the room safe, they retrieved and sent to us. Some might think a litlle expensve, but you are right on the boardwalk and beach, very nice clean beach. Only food recommendation is Happy Jack's for breakfast (on Philadelphia, next street over). Ocean City has a great beach and the Boardwalk is loaded with fun - amusement rides, shops of all time, a bus system, and police presence. No exhaust fan in bathroom, otherwise, good place to say if you want to be right on Boardwalk. Not a resort status hotel, but we would stay here again. HIghly recommend for families.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Park Place”
Reviews.Author: LisaMauied
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Ocean City, MD and we stayed at the Park Place. I wanted something right on the boardwalk so we would not have to drive around at all. This was perfect! We didn't touch our car until it was time to go home. The room, while not fancy, was clean and maid service came daily with fresh towels. Elevators were a little slow, but no big deal, you're on vacation. We took the kids to the beach every day right out in front of the hotel and left our things on the beach while we walked up to the boardwalk for lunch, usually at the Dough Roller. The kids loved the beach and the waves and we even saw some dolphins that came very close to shore! We felt very safe and everyone was very nice. Every evening we walked the boardwalk to find a place for dinner and took the tram when the kids were too tired to walk. ($3.00 is a little pricey for the tram.) We walked from 2nd Street all the way to 26th St., visited Phillips restaurant and Da Vinci's Italian a couple of times. Both very good! We were right in the middle of everything and did not find it noisy or too much. We had a great time! We would go back again. Only problem was the traffic going in on Sat. around 3. The only negative thing I have to say is about the bar/eatery on the second floor. On the way back one evening, we wanted to stop and have a drink and look over the balcony to the boardwalk. They put us at a table against the wall saying the tables overlooking the boardwalk were for dining customers. I could understand that, but there was no one there, it was late and there were at least 7 tables empty! They did not have a dinner menu and we ordered a snack. I was not happy about this as it was just stupid. We did not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyJudy
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews here, I thought I couldn't go wrong with this choice....boy, was I WRONG!!! Day 1: We arrived at the hotel earlier than the advertised check-in time. I wasn't expecting our room to be ready, but I was asked to give my cell phone number and that as soon as the room was ready we would be called. That never happened. We we went up to our room and just outside the elevator there was a sock in the tree in the hall. Day 2: When we went out onto the balcony in the morning, there was a CONDOM ON OUR BALCONY. GROSS! I went down to the front desk to inform them, and quietly asked for it to be removed. House keeping was sent to our room in a timely manner, but they cleaned our room and NEVER REMOVED THE CONDOM!!! We had to eventually do it ourselves. Later that day we we went out on the balcony, we noticed there were FOUR MORE CONDOMS right in our view on top of the parked cars. I called down to the front desk and asked to have them removed. By this time I was getting tired of trying to explain what these were to my kids. 20 - 30 minutes later, they were still there so I went down to the front desk and once again asked to have them removed. My request was greeted with irritation! It's not like I was asking for extra towels, I was asking to have condoms removed. I would have thought the situation would have been given immediate attention. Later that evening my youngest son and I decided to sit out on the balcony. What a view we had. A gang of kids SMOKING POT and URINATING in the parking lot of the hotel. Who would have thought that it could get worse after the condom incident!!! Spit on the floor of the elevator. Sock still in tree in hall. Day 3: Another day....ANOTHER CONDOM on our balcony. House keeping did come to our room immediately, but along with the condom, they also removed an item belonging to my son! Ice cream splattered all over the floor of the elevator. Sock still in tree in hall. While I understand that the hotel cannot be responsible for the actions of their visitors, I do firmly believe it is their responsibility to respond to what has happened, and to comfort of their customers. When I talked with the owner of the hotel on day three of our stay, her only response was "sorry" or "it's not our responsibility". Never once did she even ask what had been removed from our balcony that belonged to my son. I had put down in writing all the things that we had experienced during our stay. I had hoped that after she ended our discussion that she might sit down and read what I had written...I thought she might realize that she never addressed that one of her house keeping staff had taken something belonging to us. That never happened. I truly feel that she didn't care at all....she had us stuck in her hotel knowing that there were no rooms available at other hotels because of the busy week it was. The most disheartening thing was the sadness of my youngest son. He kept asking if would could go through the trash to find what house keeping had taken. He also kept asking if could call the police. Then he just asked if we would go home. I seconded his thoughts!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: amen1986
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Park Place Hotel based on the positive reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The entire hotel was clean, including the rooms. Maid service was timely and thorough. We spent most of our time either on the beach or on the boardwalk. We visited the pool briefly, which was on the small side, but nothing apparently wrong with it. The hotel is right in the middle of the boardwalk, with plenty of food and shops available to you in either direction. We didn't eat inside the hotel, everything was outside. We tried the famous French Fry place (I can't think of the name) and had a hard time seeing what the fuss was about. We also tried Fischers' fresh popcorn, which was actually very good. One observation that may be very obvious to some of you. If you visit OC after Labor Day weekend (which we did, the first weekend after LD weekend), you will probably encounter off-season hours for stores and restaurants. Even if the weather is warm, it's officially off-season, so try to plan accordingly. When we go back to OC, we'll probably head back to Park Place.

Reviews.Title: “July 15/16 with Kids Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: randman13
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel. Clean and great location. Step out of the hotel and onto the boardwalk. Almost a 1/2 mile walk to the inlet (where the rides are located). Room and hotel was clean. Quiet in the evening (we had a 6th floor bay side room). Kids (4 and 7) enjoyed the pool. Ate at Dough Boys and Hoopers. Recommend both places. Would stay here again. First time in Ocean City MD and never seen so many hotels in a 3-4 mile stretch!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth it & surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: jmoConnecticut
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on trip advisor we figured this was a can't miss hotel. Our first disappointment came when we found out that they selectively honor the AAA discount. It's a good thing that tow truck operator's don't selectively decide to honor triple a especially in bad weather! The hotel location was ok and it wasn't noisy considering it was right in the busy area of the boardwalk. The parking was good at the hotel. At check in we were told we were being upgraded to a room with a balcony, which was a pleasant surprise. We were on the street side but it was cooler especially early in the morning. Unfortunately this was the last of the pleasant surprises! The bed sheets on both beds had yellow stains on them and the blankets had holes in them! The desk manager apologized and said they would improve the training of their housekeepers to make sure this would not happen again. In my opinion the apology was not good enough! When you are spending over $200 a night you expect that the room was inspected and everything is clean and ready for your arrival. The balcony had railings with peeling paint and what appeared to be mold stains on the concrete. The two resin chairs were dirty! The elevator was pretty slow as some reviewers had stated but when we were in a hurry we used the stairs. I think management should use the stairwell once in a while! It's dirty and the doors to the stairwell should have windows. My son said it reminded him of getting on the subway in New York! The pool is small but my son enjoyed it! If this hotel is #2, I could only imagine what the other hotels are like!! We would not stay here again! To end on a positive note I'd like to recommend the Captains Galley 2 restaurant it was a bit pricey but you get what you pay for!! The food and service was excellent

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Fingers Lake Regions, New York State
Reviews.Title: “The Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: blackhillsmom
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Ocean City and it will not be our last. Right from the start, we knew that this would be the place to stay. Amy in reservations was more than willing to help us, she answered every question, every e-mail and fax. Our rooms were large, clean, bright. Nice size refrig and microwave. Beds were very comfortable, pillows ok. We faced the pool and street but it was not noisy. Every day the cleaning staff, fixed our mess, even cleaned our dishes in the sink. Never had to asked for clean towels or extra soap and shampoo it was just there. Very little noise especially with all the kids. The outdoor pool and area were always clean. Enough lounge chairs for everyone. Too bad that the pool wasn't bigger. Even had bathrooms, ice machine and vending machines by the pool. The out door deck complete with rocking chairs, umbrelled tables were so relaxing, nothing like people watching. Beach is right there, Boardwalk is clean. So much to do in that area. Even though the rates are high, it is the place to be. We were very pleased and will definitely return. We can not rate the food since we eat at other places.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room prime location”
Reviews.Author: glin930
Reviews.Content: Our family just stayed here for 3 nights stay at Park Place in OC. We are getting a 6th floor bayview room looking at parking lot & the pool. We are a party of four - two adults with two kids age 10 & 5. The room is big enough for 4 of us and very clean. The house keeping is ok. We have a light bulb problem and they fixed up right away. However, our second day they forget to bring us a kitchen wash cloth and the third day they forget to bring us any sugar/creamer/stirer package. These are minor issues I can live with it. The mattress and sofa bed are ok we have no problem with it. There is also a small balcony that has two chairs that you can seat down. Overall the room is ok. I will say it is like a typical 3 star hotel room. The location is at the prime in the broadwalk. It is also very easy access to the beach. I like the beach - very clean and usually it is not that crowded. The pool is on the second floor. It is a small rectangular size pool. My boys went there quite often. All the times we went there were not crowded so it is ok for us. I wish they had a whirpool for adult to enjoy. There is no gym in the hotel. As for parking they have plenty of space. I don't have any problem finding parking spots. I noticed there is a guy standing outside the entrance on Sat just to check who is coming in. Many people says the elevator is slow. It is slow but we are on vacation not on a rush so this is not a big deal for us. This is my first time to OC. Our family had a good time enjoing beach, golf (me only), and try out many different seafood (especially lump crabcake) restaurant. Next time if I go to OC I will probably try out different hotel. Overall we had a good stay at Park Place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation Hotel”
Reviews.Author: memeand5
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best stays in a Hotel ever. Rooms were clean and everything you could want to be right at home. The service was fast and the employees were very nice. The food was great and the view beautiful. We mostly enjoyed the rocking chairs on the porch and to just sit and enjoy the beach and relax was more than we can say. Looking forward to going back and will reccomend this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay--even in a hurricane!”
Reviews.Author: PATraveler4
Reviews.Content: We have been vacationing in Ocean City for more than 15 years. We've always enjoyed the area and have stayed in many different hotels. Our first experience at Park Place was over the Labor Day weekend (2006) -- during the time that residuals of hurricane Ernesto were pounding the OC area. The storm did a reasonable amount of damage in the area, including loss of power from Friday evening until Saturday afternoon. The hotel staff was pleasant, polite and worked diligently to assure that all guests were safe and comfortable under the circumstances. We've read complaints about the slow elevators. Even while running on generator power, the elevators seemed to work fine! We had no complaints. Despite the brief adverse weather conditions, we enjoyed our stay and the location is great. We plan to return to Park Place again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Need”
Reviews.Author: pebodell
Reviews.Content: Great location and everything you need for a nice beach weekend - oceanfront, on the boardwalk, pool, deck bar, restaurant, parking, etc. Room very nice and very comfortable. Nice balcony. Everything is right out the door. Even a Dunkin Donuts just a couple of blocks away! Price was reasonable for oceanfront queen room on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: susus116
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed 3 days/2 nights at Park Place Hotel. We arrived in the afternoon and were promptly checked in by a friendly staff member. The Room We had an Oceanview Room on the top floor (the 6th) and the view was fantastic. The room was a tad on the small side but it's comparable to, if not bigger than, other hotels in OC in the same price range. The room was very clean and the cleaning staff was timely and thorough. The bathroom is a bit small, but the B&BW products were a nice touch. We went during Senior Week and were concerned about noise from the boardwalk at night, but with the door closed, we didn't hear a thing. Overall, I'd say the room was average but nothing to write home about. Note: every light fixture in the room uses an energy saving bulb. For those who aren't accustomed to them, that means the room will appear very dark when you first turn the lights on, but within a minute or so the bulbs will become brighter. The Elevators Much has been made in the reviews about the elevators being slow and I'd have to agree. Since we were on vacation, however, it wasn't that big of a deal to us, but we overheard quite a few guests complain about how slow the elevators were. We typically used the stairs to go down to the lobby or the boardwalk. The Pool We wanted to take a dip in the pool at one point, but it was closed as they were working on it for the rest of the day. Not sure how often this occurs, but when the ocean is right there, it's not that big of a deal. Overall We thought the Park Place Hotel was great and we got exactly what was advertised. They offer incredibly fair prices considering their location, and as they say, the most important things in real estate are location, location, location. Bull on the beach, Love's Lemonade (& funnel cake), Fishers Popcorn, Dippin Dots, etc... are all a short walk away. We'll likely be staying here again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel on the Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: LifesABeach2007
Reviews.Content: Now this is the way to run a hotel! From the "Bath & Body Works" soaps and shampoo to the friendly helpful front desk staff, there was not one detail that was missed. My friend, her 2 kids and I booked two oceanfront rooms this past weekend based upon the reviews that we read on this site and had a fabulous vacation. Centrally located to the arcades, amusement parks and a short ride away from the water park, this place had it all. A clean pool and common areas as well as a breakfast buffet and daily happy hour at the bar added to our pleasant experience. If you decide to stay at this family owned establishment with the Connor family, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Overall”
Reviews.Author: ASHMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. I was able to arrange a late check in. Arrived Friday night around 9pm, the room was ready and check in was a breeze. The crib that we requested was set up in the room and ready to go. We got the baby down and unloaded the car. People watched the rest of the evening from the balcony. Maid service was quick and efficient. The only complaint is that the pool could have been cleaner. Not a big deal since we stayed here for its location rather than pool. But there was a wad of hair and a ton of sand in the pool so we skipped it. The location was amazing. Didn't have to move the car unless we wanted to. The room was quiet even with all the action going on below. Once the balcony door was shut the room was quiet and the baby never woke up from the noise. We would definately stay here again as we had a really nice time. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Just What I Was Hoping For”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly_n1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one night stay at the Park Place Hotel this past weekend and I was very happy with our stay. I trusted the reviews on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. When we arrived, we were too early to check in, but the front desk offered to take our cell number so they could call us once our room was ready, and gave us a parking pass so we could leave our car in the parking lot and wander the boardwalk. We didn't book anything special, just a bay view, two double beds room, but the room looked like it had been freshly painted, and was very clean. Everything looked almost brand new. There were even dishes in the little cabinets above the sink to my surprize. We only paid about $100 for this room and got so much for that, which was a relief. I hate paying unreasonable amounts for poor rooms with no or few amenities. Our room was on the sixth floor, which is the top floor, and though yes, we faced the parking lot and other buildings and not the ocean, we could see the bay and it was still a nice view. There were two chairs on our balcony and it wasn't so bad to sit out there. But I also believe why pay extra for an ocean view when you can just walk out to the beach two seconds a way? The hotel also has an area a floor above the boardwalk, which faces the boardwalk, with rocking chairs lined up along the rail so you can sit and have a relaxing view of the ocean anyways. A couple reviews I read before we went had mentioned uncomfortable beds and pillows but we actually found the beds and pillows in our room to be really, really comfortable. I did read another post by management that said they were replacing bedding so I think they may have done that in preparation for this coming summer season. This hotel is prime location, another perk. I would highly recommend staying here if you can. If you're a stickler for a clean room, you'll get it here. At least, we had a great experience. After reading so many horror stories about other hotels in OC, I really think this must be the odd one out!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME!!”
Reviews.Author: whimpy
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Ocean City on a Saturday a few days before Labor Day well wouldnt ya know It Ocean City was hit hard by a hurrican the night before I cant remember the hurricans name but they were hit hard! We got there the board walk was covered with sand the benches you couldnt even see them they looked like big sand mounts.Our room was on the 5th floor oceanfront what a view I might add!!! wonderful!! With everything that was going on that morning the staff was great they were friendly, calm, and ready to make your stay great! Our room was ready ontime as promised we arrived In our room it was spotless the soap and all the little extra things you get are a nice touch!! It was just amazing how fast the town of OceanCity got things cleaned up! I would send any of my friends or family to this hotel. The room was clean the sheets are snow white staff is friendly...the only thing bad I can say is dont plan on sleeping on the sofa bed that thing was awful...for sleeping... but I did read they will be changing mattresses and sofa beds I hope. We stayed for 3 days everyday the women that cleaned our room did a great job she didnt forget a thing she was friendly also and she was busy they had a booked hotel that weekend everyday she would see us she would say if you need anything just let me know just a friendly warm person. Now for the bar downstairs we never heard a thing and that was packed all 3 nights we could see people from the balcony and It was full but when you closed the door you didnt hear anything you would never know there was a bar down there.The only thing I can say Is keep up the great job and I hope to return in 2007 Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay as always.”
Reviews.Author: LauraCav
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a four day trip to Ocean City, MD. where we again stayed at the Park Place Hotel. We have stayed here before and were not disappointed this time. We were greeted by a friendly and helpful hotel staff and a we had a room with a beautiful view. I have been to Ocean City many times and this is the best service and quality I have encountered so far. Park Place Hotel is conveniently located right on the boardwalk within walking distance to just about everything. Our room was spotless and very comfortable and it included a microwave, small fridge, plates, utensils, etc. Parking at this hotel is never a problem. The property is well-maintained and clean, and the staff is very friendly. I really enjoyed the Bath & Body Works soap and shampoo that were provided!. We enjoyed our stay as usual and will most definitely return and we will recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: abakar47
Reviews.Content: I called the property and reserved the room for one night the week before my wife and I were going to Ocean City. Once we got there, the lady at the desk told us that there would be construction adjacent to our room starting at 6 in the morning. When I asked for a room away from the construction, they gave me one with a higher rate than I had originally booked for. The lady at the desk refused to give me my original rate, but said she could give me a discount if I was an AARP member. I'm not even 30!
