I thought it was inconsiderate that they didn't tell me of the construction, even though it looked like it had been going on for weeks, and then didn't even give me my original rate. They could definitely work on customer service. Otherwise the room was average.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality hotel for a low price”
Reviews.Author: notashoobie
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a four day trip to Ocean City, MD. where we stayed at the Park Place Hotel. What a pleasant experience. We really enjoyed our stay. We were greeted by a friendly front desk clerk and a room with a beautiful view. The room was a nice size, had good quality furniture, soap products from Bath and Body Works, and a decent sized balcony. Although there wasn't in-room internet access, there was a computer set up in the lobby for this purpose. My only complaints are the horrible mattress (maybe other rooms had better ones) and that the cleaning service could have been a bit better. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “High Quality Hotel at a Fraction of the Typical Cost!”
Reviews.Author: Coppercat
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I felt lucky to find a vacancy at this hotel a few days prior to our visit. I have stayed in hotels over 1,000 nights of my life, so I know what I'm talking about when it comes to quality! I have been to Ocean City many times and most of the hotels I have stayed in are old, dumpy and overpriced. Not the case here. The Park Place is a fairly new property right on the boardwalk. Our room (not ocean-front) was $69/night, which was a steal. I checked many other hotels and prices were significantly higher than that and the locations were not nearly as convenient. Parking at this hotel is a breeze - we easily found spaces in the lot every time. The property is well-maintained and clean, and the staff is very friendly. Our room was surprisingly nice for the cost, and it included a microwave, small fridge, plates, utensils, etc. I really enjoyed the Bath & Body Works soap and shampoo that were provided! My only complaints, which are minor, are (1) the beds provided little back support, (2) the pillows were flat, and (3) the towels were very thin and "hard". Otherwise than that, we really enjoyed our stay and would most definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fosnaugh
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Bike week in Ocean City & stayed @ the Park Place Hotel. It was great. The location is perfect, the staff our very helpful & friendly & the room is larger than most hotel rooms. Each morning we would go to breakfast & by the time we returned, our room was already made up. We will definately return to Park Place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 4 days at the beach”
Reviews.Author: luvmymic
Reviews.Content: First we arrived 4 hours before we could check in...the young lady at the counter offered us a place to change into our bathing suits, and a pool pass if we wanted to relax by the pool while waiting for our room to be ready. She took our cell phone number to call as soon as it was ready. We changed, and hit the beach!! beautiful day. We had some lunch and were told our room was ready. Our room was ready 2 hours prior to check in time but they allowed us to check in and drop our stuff. The room was beautiful We took non-oceanfront, our view was the pool and some other buildings, but hey we weren't there to sit in our room..we were there to sit on the beach. We needed some extra pillows (I am almost 6 months pregnant, gotta prop everything up to sleep). They had the pillows in our room in a matter of minutes, as well as extra towels. I did read other reviews, some said the elevators were "slow"...yes, sometimes we had to wait a few minutes for them, but again, your on vacation to relax not rush to the next spot and if your in that big of a hurry there are stairs to take not far from the elevator. I found this to be one of the best locations if you want to be near it all. When I was tired I was able to head on the deck overlooking the beach and boards while my husband and son went doing what they wanted to do. We didn't have to move our car until we were leaving. The rooms were very clean each and every day.. I will DEFINATELY be returning to this hotel. I have been to OC way too many times to count but this one was the best!! thank you Park Place staff for a wonderful getaway!!

Reviews.Title: “Park Place Hotel- Had a Great Time Again:)”
Reviews.Author: pointe3579
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from our third stay at Park Place and the third stay was every bit as good as the first and second. We had the unfortunate experience of arrving to OC right as Ernesto was coming up the coast so it was rather rainy. When I made the reservation, I had asked Park Place for a sixth floor room, knowing that this is the best view. When we arrived we were informed that due to the weather (aka Ernesto), we would be given a choice of the sixth floor room we wanted or another on the third floor. That was really sweet and one of the front desk guys even took us up to show us both rooms so we could make a decision. Also a power outage at the hotel left our room a little dark, but the backup generator kept the hall lit and one elevator working. Probably the thing that will make my friend and I customers of Park Place forever is when we checked out we noticed we were charged less for our three night stay then we were orginally told. It was explained to us that Friday night (probably due to the tropical storm), was discounted. My friend and I were shocked because it is not like the hotel wanted the weather to be bad. My friends and I will always remember that and we will not look any further than Park Place for our next trip to OC. Overall the hotel has great rooms, great location and probably some of the best customer service out of any hotel I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “See you next year !!”
Reviews.Author: BEINERGIRL
Reviews.Content: Just got back from visiting Ocean City, Maryland for the first time and had a nice visit despite the cloudy weather and power outage we experienced at the hotel on Friday evening thanks to "Ernesto" heading up North! The Park Place Hotel is very nice and the accommodations very comfortable and clean. The kitchenette is great, especially when traveling with small children, along with the rest of the amenities. The location was perfect and is close to everything. The only drawback is that they do not have "automated doors" upon entering the building through the parking lot, which makes it difficult for guests traveling with strollers and bringing your luggage in and out of the hotel. The Conner's Beach Cafe, which is located at Park Place is okay. It's not an eatery I would recommend, but for a quick snack it's fine. The Conner's Sail Loft (Deck Bar), was very good and they offer a daily "Happy Hour" from 3:00 PM - 6:00 PM. The $2.00 Margarita's were great, and after dealing with two toddlers all day, my husband and I made sure we didn't miss it! Regarding the small pool, slow elevators, hot hallways, construction, as indicated in previous reviews ... Yes, the pool is small, but litte kids love it! Think of it as one BIG square bath tub ... Ha, Ha, Ha!! Slow elevators, we didn't fine them any slower or faster, just right. Hot hallways, no one was sweating! Construction, yes, there is a condo being built right next door to the hotel, but we were located on the left side of the building (Bayview) and didn't hear very much, but if your room was on the right (Bayview) or left (Ocean Front) then you would hear the noise, as one guest complained to us and checked-out to another hotel. Park Place did try to accomodate them with another room, but they were still not satisfied and left. Overall, we would definitely stay at this hotel again. I must admit the "Front Desk" handled the power outage with ease and tried to make the guests feel as comfortable as possible. The hotel has a back-up generator, but some rooms had less electricity than others, such as ours, and lended us flashlights. Upon checking out on Saturday, by noon the electricity was back and we also received a courtesy discount for our Friday night stay for any inconvenience, and the hotel also offered their guests FREE Dunkin Donuts coffee in the lobby that morning, which was great, so who can beat all that!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: mom2twogirlz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 small children, and we were very happy with the hotel. It was clean, and the kitchenette was perfect for us. The staff was excellent - we asked for an iron and had it in about 5 mins. We even asked about staying an extra night, and they were very accomodating about that. The location was perfect too. The only minus for us was trying to get the stroller out to the boardwalk we had to go through the restaurant. That was odd at times when it was crowded with people. We enjoyed ourselves and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: cmk3026
Reviews.Content: I recently had a great weekend stay. The hotel is in an excellent location and the beach and boardwalk are steps away. The maid service always did an excellent job. I had a room overlooking the ocean with a private balcony and never had a problem with noise. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay, will do it again!”
Reviews.Author: cfgoesaway
Reviews.Content: Family get away, plus an elderly relative, and would not think of staying anywhere else! Front desk help very accommodating, restaurant has everything you need for breakfast, snacks, etc. And close to Thrashers fries! Beach area large, with chairs and umbrellas available for purchase - which I would advise, because with the wind by the ocean, umbrellas brought from home don't seem to stay in place! Rooms large enough for 4 adults, and cleaning staff does a superb job.

Reviews.Title: “Stay At The Park Place”
Reviews.Author: OCB'Walk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Place July 30 - Aug. 3, 2006, would recommend it to everyone. CLEAN rooms, courteous staff (especially night desk clerk and 6th floor crew). If you get the chance - STAY there. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: destinationunkwn
Reviews.Content: Overall I think the hotel was very nice. I loved the convience of staying right on the beach, they have a entrance on and off the boardwalk which is great. I was very pleased that the room was clean, plus the bed was comfortable, which can be a issue in some hotels. Only down fall is the very slow elevator, the hot hallways and the security deposit they make you put down (per person). I understand it is to cover them but can't they keep your credit card on file for that!?! One more thing, the traffic going towards the inlet can be heavy. In the evenings it can take forever. So the further down you stay in OC the longer you may sit if you are driving. The bus is great and cheap if you are just doing things w/ in OC. Either way I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kevinh12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very good value on the boardwalk. We have two young daughters and the location proved to be excellent for proximity to rides and great food. The hotel was built in 2000 and the room was very clean and the staff was very friendly. The efficiency part of the room is small but provided much needed extra sink and they also include some silverware cups and bowls to use. I would suggest an ocean front room even though it is more expensive, i think it is worth every penny. The air conditioner in our room was a little loud but it worked excellent and kept us cool in the intense heat wave we were experiencing. Our family will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value...but nothing to write home about!”
Reviews.Author: traveling81
Reviews.Content: Park Place kinda puts me in a quandry. For the price ($225 for non Ocean View in the middle of summer), the place is a SCREAMING value for Ocean City. This is easily one of the top 5 hotels in Ocean City, but that is sadly because the OC Hotel scene is filled with rotting 30+ year old hotels the Harrison Group won't spend money on. Park Place is not dirty or run down, but it is very...below average compared to any other non Ocean City Hotel. We normally stay at the Holiday in on 17th street, but they wanted $400 a night, and seeing all the good reviews, I thought we would try park place. Pros- Good location Cheap Kept up better than 95% of the hotels in OC. Things to keep in mind- The Hotel as a whole is VERY small. Lobby is the smalledt I have ever seen. Rooms are smaller than most other hotels Ihave been at. The two double beds were very small, and the kitchenette was a joke. The hotel, though new, gives the impression it was built on a tight budget. The rooms seem to have many more year on them than the hotel is old...but they were clean. The hotel has an issue with temperatures. The hallways were almost muggy, and the rooms we cold...except the bathroom, which was like the Tahiti desert for some reason. There is no indoor pool, and the wireless internet never really worked for me. There are only two elevators, and they were creaky and slow. The elevator creaked and lurched to the point it seemed unsafe, and once even moved after the doors had opened, and I was in the middle of getting off. Even odder, this is the first building I have been in, where instead of having the elevator safety permit posted in the the elevator...they have a sign that says anyone who wants to see the permit should ask the front desk? Seems a bit odd to me? Anyway...there is another reason I will never stay at Park Place again. Me and my wife were supposed to check out on Tuesday, but instead had to check out on Sunday at 1pm due to unexpected circumstances. Now I fully understand not getting the cost of Sunday night back, but the manager insisted on charging use for Monday also even though we would be long gone. When you check in they give you a list of stuff to initial, and one is that you "understand there will be no refunds for leaving early". When this was explained, I basically understood I didn't have a leg to stand on...but after the woman billed me for two nights I would not be there...the other cashier asked her if our "room #" was clean, because they were sold out, and trying to get someone in it. For some reason, this just made me angry to the point I would never stay there again. In closing, if you are going to OC and feel that a hotel experiance is an important part of you vaction, spend the money on the Hilton or Holiday inn...there really is nothing else in OC that is worth the money...especially with how much bigger and cheaper Myrtle Beach is.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kklldd
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean. We stayed from July 5 - 9. The fridge isn't full size but it's larger than a dorm-size fridge. The microwave, coffee maker, sink and fridge make up a little kitchenette which is nice. There were 2 double beds and an extra area which contained a sofa, coffee table, dining table with 2 chairs. Also a nice balcony. They had a great happy hour every day from 3-6. Margeritas for $2...can't beat that. It's a very casual outside bar....we took our 3 1/2 year old son to the bar and gave him some snacks to eat while we enjoyed our cocktails. Only complaint was no VCR in the room and it cost $5.25 a night to rent one. Luckily I found this out ahead of time and we packed our own VCR. The beach has nice wooden walkways that get you halfway down the sand before we had to start pulling the wagon down the sand. The hotel is right on the boardwalk and close to wonderful restaurants. We enjoyed cocktails and beer and wonderful meals at the restaurants on the boardwalk. Our little boy had a wonderful time, too. It definitely gets crowded at night! If you're looking for a serene, quiet location this isn't the place....at last not at 10pm at night on a weekend. You can definitely do a lot of people watching on your balcony. But if you close the door and turn the air on, you can barely hear anything outside. So sleeping was fine. Again, the hotel was very clean from the beds to the bathrooms and seemed more modern than many hotels I have stayed in. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rattus
Reviews.Content: I am very glad that there was an oceanfront view room available after being put on the waiting list for one. The bay view rooms look out onto buildings, and I would have been very disappointed had we been forced to stay in one. Our oceanfront room was always immaculately cleaned, and the view was SPECTACULAR! Our room was directly above the outdoor bar area, so we couldn't sleep with the doors open. The noise of the crowds and the music would have kept us awake, but with the door shut, we didn't hear anything. The hotel is very clean. The food leaves room for improvement, but there are tons of restaurants on the boardwalk. Flavors of Italy has AWESOME food. The hotel offers food vouchers for purchase. I don't recommend them though. Breakfast isn't great at the hotel, and the $60 voucher that we purchased bought us a HORRIBLE meal at Adolfo's. The food was very expensive, and the meat was low quality with tons of fat and gristle. I can't rate the other restaurants on the certificate, but I would never buy another voucher from this hotel. Be prepared as well to pay for everything from local phone calls to VCRs and DVD players. The pool is very small, but clean and well maintained. There was a construction site directly next to the hotel where there were workers hammering, sawing, and drilling all day. I am VERY glad we had a room on the other side of the building, but we could hear the racket anyway. All in all, I would stay at Park Place again. It was very family friendly, and Ocean City, Maryland is a lovely family oriented beach! I value the quietness of a room at night and the view, so I thought this hotel was nice.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED everything about the Park Place!!”
Reviews.Author: ntrtainrCoventry
Reviews.Content: You could not ask for a CLEANER hotel with a PERFECT location on the boardwalk! We requested an Oceanfront King and were given a perfect room on the 6th floor with a GREAT view! The checkin was a breeze and the maid service was exemplary as well! Everyone there right down to the maintenance supervisor (who also works a night job there as well as his main position) was VERY friendly and helpful in everything we ever needed. As others have stated, we didn't need to touch our car the whole time we were there because of the perfect boardwalk location. We will NEVER stay anywhere else but here. Yes, the elevator moves slowly but, what the heck, you're on vacation aren't you?

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel sits on 2nd street which is close to everything. When I parked my car to check in I didn't have to get into again until it was time to check out. Located on the boardwalk I walked to eat, shop, goof off or just whatever. The staff is very friendly. I go to ocean city once or twice every year and stay in a different hotel each time. I can say after staying at the Park Place Hotel I will always choose Park Place from here on out.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the whole family!”
Reviews.Author: FuzzyW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Place Hotel over Memorial Day Weekend and had a great time! The room was very clean. The small refrigerator and microwaver were great. The bathroom was quite large and very clean. I felt guilty at how much sand my children managed to track into the room and tub, but everyday the room would once again be spotless! The balcony was great and the location on the boardwalk was perfect. You are only allowed to park one vehicle in their parking lot which was a bit of a problem for us as we arrived from two different states. However, the staff was great at suggesting alternate (and free) parking arrangements for us. I will stay at this hotel again and would highly suggest it to anybody looking for a great place to stay on the boardwalk!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was leery of staying here, as I usually prefer the northern area of Ocean City. However, due to the fact I was only travelling with my 12-year-old daughter, and the generally favorable reviews on TripAdvisor, I decided to give it a chance. The staff was gracious and caring (Sam and Shanna, especially) and the service was over and above anything I have experienced in OC. The rooms were clean and well stocked and the small balcony overlooking the boardwalk and ocean was welcome. Only drawbacks were the overly warm hallways (I have asthma and am bothered by such things) and the spotty wireless internet service. Will DEFINITELY stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Clean, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: wenbenoit
Reviews.Content: We just visited Ocean City and used Trip Advisor to pick a hotel on the boardwalk. We got a military rate and stayed two nights at Park Place Hotel. The hotel has an excellent location, close to all the attractions, however this is also a problem if you get a room overlooking the ocean because of the noise level. Seems like at night the local kids hang out on the boardwalk and they can get loud. It wasn't a problem past 11pm and our son did not hear anything so it wasn't a big deal. The room was very clean and we had everything we needed: refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, blow dryer, and toilettries from Bath and Body Works. The pool was small, like some people have mentioned but they have two sun decks. The pool is on back and on the front overlooking the ocean is another sundeck with a bar. The only problem I had is that the internet was not working during the three days we were there. There is a small restaurant on Baltimore Blvd right behind the hotel that serves excellent breakfast. There is also a seafood restaurant at the end of the boardwalk (Harrisons) that we found to be very good for the price with great views of the inlet.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, two children ages 6 and 14 and I have stayed at Park Place for the last 3 years. We have ALWAYS been very satified with the hotel. I am EXTREMELY particular about a clean room and have NEVER had any problems with them. I expecially love the nice touch with the bath and body works products. We have ALWAYS stayed in the same room and it was DIRECTLY above the bar area and we love it. We do NOT drink nor do we smoke and have NEVER been bother by the noise level or smoke at the bar. Our children love the pool and I have never noticed anything out of the ordinary about the color that would worry me. We also the love convenence of the location. You could stay a week and never really need to move your car. I called for reservations for this comming year and was told that ALL off the rooms as of fall of 2005 have been redone or freshed up with new carpet and flooring. Thank you Park Place for MANY happy times in the past and I am sure more to come. Julie from PA

Reviews.Title: “The best on the boards!”
Reviews.Author: THECOOK4
Reviews.Content: My family goes to Ocean City numerous times of the year and we have stayed at alot of different hotels. This was by far the best. The bar is not loud! When I booked my room I was also told that my balcony would be near the bar if I wanted to move. I was worried my first trip there being that I have a toddler and didn't want to hear loud music. However, my worries were gone when we arrived. The pool was also nice. It wasn't very large but, no one really wants to be at the pool during a stay at the beach anyways. The housekeepers were very nice and even stopped at our room when we first arrived to introduce themselves and to see if we needed anything. Needless to say, we book our room very early in the year to be sure we have a room here. We don't even consider staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and an exceptional experience at the Park Place Hotel in Ocean City, Maryland. The staff went out of their way to take care of our every need. While there, our van broke down. The staff worked with us and even allowed us a very very late check out to accomadate us. This hotel has the highest quality staff who really look out after your needs. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Ocean City, Maryland.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: momnanny
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Park Place last New Years...we loved it so much, we made a trip back the following month. We travel to Ocean City often but usually stay in a privately owned condo. When the condo is not available, we stay in hotels & have tried quite a few in OC. The Park Place was one of the better ones we have stayed in. The staff was wonderful...very personable & helpful. When we were there in Feb, our room was on the corner of the building & would not get warm. I called the front desk to see if someone could come up to check out the heat..they sent someone up right away. The heat was working fine, but room wasn't warming up due to being on outside wall & it was very cold outside. We didn't ask for another room but they moved us immediately to an inside room (after showing us the room to make sure it was okay) & that room warmed up very quickly. They were very concerned about our comfort. The hotel was only open on week-ends in the winter & it did take a while for things to heat up after being closed all week. We read reviews of this hotel & the complaints about the small pool. Of course the pool was closed for the season when we were there, but it didn't look all that small..looked sufficient for a quick dip to cool off. We will definitely stay here again...in fact probably for New Years this year!

Reviews.Title: “Park Place exceeded my expectations *loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Park Place was very clean and everyone was so friendly as I came to check in. I loved the view of the ocean and it was a beautiful view from the balcony. The hotel was so clean and I didn't expect it just because I figured that there would be sand all over from it being right on the boardwalk. It was great to walk right out of my room and onto the boardwalk. I would definitely stay there again. the food at the restaurant was good too. I would recommend spending a night there for dinner after a long day on the boardwalk. The pool was okay though. It was kind of small but it was enough to get cooled off before dinner. Definitely recommend Park Place for anyone with a family that wants to spend their time on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “IT Rocks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Park Place hotel is amazing!! The manager is very kind and extremly helpful!! The staff for the most part is very friendly. The place was very clean and the pool was nice for our two kids. Me and my family loved it and my son said that we should come back here every year!! Anyone who has givin this hotel a bad review is out of their mind!!! I whole heartly recommed this place for anyone who is coming to Ocean City!!! Just a side note Conners is ok, but there are some better places to eat!! Again Park Place is the BEST!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room Ok; basic, clean, somewhat roomy. Nice Terrace. Overlooking boardwalk, beach and bar. But when closed sliding glass door - absolutely no problem with noise. Staff fine. Convenient free parking. The restaurant on the 2nd floor level o'looking the boardwalk is a great place to hang out and have a drink and watch the crowd stroll by.

Reviews.Title: “Great change from the chains!”
Reviews.Author: Pjayne1
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and personal reasons and sometimes it feels like all hotels are the same-- same boring room, so-so food, ok service. But the family-owned and operated Park Place is COMPLETELY different! The staff is super firendly and responsive-- very guest focused! And the place is SPOTLESS! When was the last time you stayed on the beach and there was NO SAND in the halls? Rooms are beautiful-- ocean side views can't be beat. Loved having cocktails on the deck at the hotel bar and watching the action on the beach and boardwalk. And the amazing location makes the hotel a super convenience for families. To me, Park Place is the best value in Ocean City!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Park Place Hotel since it has opened and have never been disappointed. All rooms look brand new, with great views, plenty of room and spacious balconies. The rooms are always was very clean and the Bodyworks shampoo, conditioner, and soap they place in the rooms are a real treat. The refrigerator, sink, microwave and dishes supplied were spotless and very handy. The heated pool is great all season long. The food at both Conner's Beach Cafe and the Sail Loft Deck is delicious and reasonably priced. The access to the beach is really convenient. You can walk to just about everything from this location, not just the beach and the boardwalk. The hotel bar has an awesome view. The music by the bar is not too loud and the staff is very friendly. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone I know visiting Ocean City. We will keep coming back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “not much for your money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: what a waste of money. i took my parents here along with my husband and 2 children. we stayed in a room that was suggested for 6 persons. this room was so small that i felt as if we were all sleeping in the same bed. as for the pool, it was dirty and cloudy all 4 of the days that we were there. on the up side, the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Beachbob
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at Park Place from July 2 thru July 9. I chose this hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor, and was not at all disappointed. Even during the booking process by E-mail everyone connected with the hotel went out of their way to answer all my questions and concerns. We arrived on July 2nd at about 3:15 PM, prime check-in time. Check-in took all of 3 minutes, very efficient. Upon entering our room we found it to be exceptionally clean, stocked with plenty of towels, dishes and utensils, coffee pot, microwave, and refrigerator. The view of the beach and boardwalk was excellent. The was the Sail Loft deck bar on one side, and a sitting area on the deck level. At no point was the noise from the deck or the bar bothersome. Maid service was prompt every day, and the room was cleaned beyond my expectations each time. Over the course of a week you would think there would be plenty of opportunity for someone to make a mistake, but none ever came. I was very pleased with the performace of everyone associated with Park Place, and with the 10% discount offered for a week long stay, the price is reasonable by OC standards. To the employees of Park Place, keep up the good work, you have won a permanent customer.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: LLF
Reviews.Content: My family and I (All 23 of us) just returned from Ocean City, Maryland and had a wonderful stay at The Park Place Hotel on 2nd & 3rd streets. We were right on the boardwalk and there was plenty of action and fun things to do there. Our stay was wonderful. Service was above average and whatever we needed and whenever we needed it they were there to help us out. I truly recommend this hotel and we look forward to going back next year. Thank you again Park Place Hotel you met all of our expectations. Very clean, helpful, courteous, and attentative to all our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I would like to thank the staff for a great weekend at your hotel.We needed a break and it sure was the ticket.Thanks again

HotelInfo.Name: Park Place Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 207 North Atlantic Avenue, Between 2nd & 3rd Streets, Ocean City, MD 21843
